original: 'di nyid rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid rdzogs pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the intuition of the non-differentiation of Vajradhara and Nairatmya.

original: chos nyid dag pa ni chos rnams shin tu dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid dag pa ni chos rnams shin tu dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of reality is the complete purity of all things.🔽This is the very thing

original: 'di nyid / mkhas pas cho ga gsungs pa yis //
analyzed: 'di nyid / mkhas pas cho ga gsungs pa yis //
translated: which the wise one has taught as the rite,

original: rnam pa lnga po bsgom pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po bsgom pa nyid //
translated: the meditation on the five aspects.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon de gcig pa nyid de yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid yin par cho ga 'dis so //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon de gcig pa nyid de yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid yin par cho ga 'dis so //
translated: The moon, the sun, and the seed are identical, and that is the very pure reality realm, by this rite.

original: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Meditation is what is to be meditated upon.

original: mkhas pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mkhas pas rtogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The wise one is the one who has realized the nature of things.

original: yang na rnam pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the aspects are the Vajradhara.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The meditation is the non-differentiation from the conventional truth.

original: bsgom pa nyid ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa snyoms par zhugs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa snyoms par zhugs pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The meditation is the establishment of the union of the non-differentiation of means and insight.

original: cho ga lnga ni ye shes rnam pa lnga'i cho ga 'dis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: cho ga lnga ni ye shes rnam pa lnga'i cho ga 'dis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The five rites are the rites of the five intuitions, by this rite of the five intuitions, with the intuition of the varieties.

original: mkhas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The wise one is the nature of perfect pristine consciousness.🔽This explains that the mirror of the five pristine consciousnesses and so on are the nature of the dakinis, and both are the state of union of Vajradhara.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli

original: 'dis ni ye shes lnga'i me long la sogs pa bdag nyid de dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams gnyi ga kha sbyor ba nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes lnga'i me long la sogs pa bdag nyid de dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams gnyi ga kha sbyor ba nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva.

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan //🔽zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan // zhes pa smos te /
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.

original: sems can dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid dang mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje sems dpa'i khu ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi🔽bdag nyid bstan te /
analyzed: sems can dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid dang mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor rdo rje sems dpa'i khu ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi🔽bdag nyid bstan te /
translated: The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.🔽The union of the ālikāli🔽is the seat of Vajrasattva.

original: a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs ka'i ba spu'i khung bu re re nas spros nas slar yang tshur 'dus te ba spu'i khung nas zhugs nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung bas lha mo thams cad
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i thugs ka'i ba spu'i khung bu re re nas spros nas slar yang tshur 'dus te ba spu'i khung nas zhugs nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung bas lha mo thams cad
translated: The two garlands of vowels and consonants emanate from each pore of the heart of Vajradhara inseparable from Nairātmya, and again they gather and enter through the pores and emerge from the vajra path, and all the goddesses

original: kyi dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba yin no //
analyzed: kyi dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba yin no //
translated: are empowered in the maṇḍala.

original: mnyam sbyor zhes pa la mnyam pa ni a'a li k'a li dag ni dbyer med par gang de 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mnyam sbyor zhes pa la mnyam pa ni a'a li k'a li dag ni dbyer med par gang de 'jug pas so //
translated: “Union” means that which enters into the inseparability of the vowels and consonants.

original: spro ba @88b dang bsdu ba dag gis de rnal 'byor yin no //
analyzed: spro ba @88b dang bsdu ba dag gis de rnal 'byor yin no //
translated: That is the yoga of emanation and gathering.

original: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan ni gdan de'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan ni gdan de'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhugs pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the seat of Vajrasattva is the meaning of the abode of Vajradhara, the nature of the seat.

original: yang na a'a li k'a li mnyam pa ni nyis 'gyur du blta ba'o //🔽mnyam sbyor ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: yang na a'a li k'a li mnyam pa ni nyis 'gyur du blta ba'o // mnyam sbyor ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: Or, the union of the vowels and consonants is the view of the pairs.

original: de yang rdo rje sems dpa'i de kho na nyid gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems dpa'i de kho na nyid gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The union is the gathering, which is the nature of the three realities of Vajrasattva.

original: gdan ni gnas so //
analyzed: gdan ni gnas so //
translated: The seat is the place.

original: a'a li zhes pa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa bcu drug rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis nyis 'gyur du sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: a'a li zhes pa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa bcu drug rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis nyis 'gyur du sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The vowels are the sixteen vowels beginning with a, doubled by the nature of means and insight, making thirty-two.

original: k'a li zhes pa ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams da dha da dha ya la dang bcas pa bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur las ni yi ge brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: k'a li zhes pa ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams da dha da dha ya la dang bcas pa bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur las ni yi ge brgyad cu'o //
translated: The consonants are the thirty-four consonants beginning with ka, with da, dha, da, and dha, and ya and la, making forty, doubled to make eighty letters.

original: de ltar mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i rnam par dag pas brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i rnam par dag pas brgyad cu'o //
translated: Thus, the thirty-two letters are the purity of the thirty-two major marks, and the eighty are the purity of the eighty minor marks.

original: 'di ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mnga' ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mnga' ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' yin pa'i don to //
translated: This means that this is the vajra being, endowed with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: yang na bdag med ma la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga rnams chos kyi dbyings su son pa zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dang de kho na nyid gsum dbyer med pa de las byung ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi
analyzed: yang na bdag med ma la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga rnams chos kyi dbyings su son pa zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dang de kho na nyid gsum dbyer med pa de las byung ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi
translated: Or else, the fifteen dakinis such as Nairatmya, having reached the dharmadhatu, are the moon, sun, seed, and the inseparability of the three realities.

original: rang bzhin me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag med ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag med ma yin no //
translated: From that, the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhatu, the nature of the mirror-like and so forth, the nature of the five wisdoms, is Nairatmya, inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba /
translated: The union of Alikali

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan //🔽zhes pa ste /🔽a'a li shes rab po //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan // zhes pa ste / a'a li shes rab po //
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva himself.

original: k'a li thabs so //
analyzed: k'a li thabs so //
translated: Alikali is wisdom and means.

original: gnyi ga gang mnyam pa ni mnyam pa'i ye shes dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga gang mnyam pa ni mnyam pa'i ye shes dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The union of both is the realization of the inseparability of the wisdom of equality.

original: de la go rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de la go rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: In that, the seat of Vajrasattva is the seat of the gnosis of equality.

original: go'i sgras dbang po ste /
analyzed: go'i sgras dbang po ste /
translated: The word go is the sense organ.

original: dbang po rnams me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis spro ba'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis spro ba'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The faculties are the nature of the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition, and so forth, and are the nature of the emanation, Vajra Holder.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed par gyur pas na bsdu ba'i rang bzhin gyi bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni mi phyed par gyur pas na bsdu ba'i rang bzhin gyi bdag med ma'o //
translated: Vajra means indivisible, and so is the nature of the gathering, Nairatmya.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje go thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa gang sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de go rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje go thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa gang sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de go rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: This is the vajra, the method, and the wisdom, indivisible, the being, the unity of the three existences, the vajra being.

original: de'i gdan ni gdan no //
analyzed: de'i gdan ni gdan no //
translated: His seat is the seat.

original: 'di rnams gdan du gyur pas khyab pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams gdan du gyur pas khyab pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Since these are the seat, the vajra being pervades the seat.

original: de nyid / yi ge las byung gong bu la //
analyzed: de nyid / yi ge las byung gong bu la //
translated: That itself:

original: h'um phat yi ge dgod mi bya //🔽yi ge'i @89a * //
analyzed: h'um phat yi ge dgod mi bya // yi ge'i @89a * //
translated: Do not place the syllables hum and phat🔽In the mass arisen from the syllables.

original: sgras a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis so //
analyzed: sgras a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis so //
translated: The word syllable means the two garlands of vowels and consonants.

original: de las byung ba ni de las byung ba de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni de las byung ba de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Arisen from that means arisen from that, that nature.

original: gong bu ni gang gi lus de'o //
analyzed: gong bu ni gang gi lus de'o //
translated: The mass is the body of that.

original: yi ge las byung gong bu ni yi ge h'um nyid de bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge las byung gong bu ni yi ge h'um nyid de bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate arisen from the syllable is the syllable HŪṀ itself, which is Vajradhara inseparable from Nairātmya.

original: yi ge phat 'byed par byed pa mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge phat 'byed par byed pa mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: The syllable PHAṬ is not desired as a separator.

original: yi ge h'um gi sa bon nyid las bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag mtshan rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi sa bon nyid las bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag mtshan rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
translated: This vajra, the hand implement of Vajradhara inseparable from Nairātmya, arises from the seed syllable HŪṀ, which is Nairātmya inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dbyer med pa nyid kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid dbyer med pa nyid kyi sa bon no //
translated: The seed syllable of the indivisibility of the two is the nature of the ultimate truth.

original: yang na yi ge'i sgras ni mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo bas na yi ge'o //
analyzed: yang na yi ge'i sgras ni mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo bas na yi ge'o //
translated: Or, the syllable is unchanging and unmoving, and is therefore a syllable.

original: de las byung ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de las byung ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Arisen from that is the conventional truth, which is Vajradhara.

original: de'i gong bu ni sku kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid bsdus pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i gong bu ni sku kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid bsdus pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: His aggregate is the body, which is the nature of the ultimate truth, the meaning of which is included in the conventional truth.🔽What is it like?

original: ci 'dra ba yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: The syllable HŪṀ is taught:

original: h'um zhes pa'i ha ni thabs so //
analyzed: h'um zhes pa'i ha ni thabs so //
translated: The syllable HA is the method.

original: au shes rab po //
analyzed: au shes rab po //
translated: The syllable Ū is wisdom.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems zla ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems zla ba'o //
translated: The moon is the bodhicitta, which is the inseparability of the two.

original: de yang thig le stong pa rang bzhin med pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thig le stong pa rang bzhin med pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is also adorned with the empty bindu, which is essenceless.

original: phat shes rab bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: phat shes rab bdag med ma'o //
translated: The phat is the wisdom prajñā, which is Nairātmya.

original: de'i yi ge ni rtog pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yi ge ni rtog pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: Its syllable is the activity of conceptualization.

original: 'dod mi bya ni mi 'dod pa ste lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi don la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod mi bya ni mi 'dod pa ste lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi don la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The “not to be desired” is the undesirable, which is the engagement in the benefit of all sentient beings through the very state of natural perfection.

original: yang na / yi ge las byung gong bu la /
analyzed: yang na / yi ge las byung gong bu la /
translated: Or else, the “syllable” is the aggregate that arises from the syllable.

original: g-yo ba med par rang bzhin du byung ba'i gong bu'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med par rang bzhin du byung ba'i gong bu'o //
translated: It is the aggregate that arises naturally without movement.

original: yi ge ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge ni byed pa ste /
translated: The “syllable” is the agent.

original: rdo rje lte ba'i nang na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems g-yo ba med pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i nang na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems g-yo ba med pas so //
translated: It is the bodhicitta that abides in the center of the vajra without movement.

original: rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause?

original: h'um ste yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: h'um ste yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: It is the syllable hūṃ, which is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de yang de'i phat kyis 'byed pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang de'i phat kyis 'byed pa mi 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, its phat is not desired to be separated.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni don 'di nyid gtang bar mi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni don 'di nyid gtang bar mi bya ba yin no //
translated: The word “also” means that this meaning should not be abandoned.

original: yang na dbang po de rnams dga' ba mi 'dor bas na yi ge ste de lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang po de rnams dga' ba mi 'dor bas na yi ge ste de lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, the “syllable” is the faculty that does not abandon bliss. It is such.

original: las byung ba ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags chen pos dbang po thams cad la sogs pa gnyis su med pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las byung ba ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod chags chen pos dbang po thams cad la sogs pa gnyis su med pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising from action is the great passion characterized by passion, because of the nondual entity of all the sense organs, etc.

original: gong bu dang 'dra bas na gong bu ste /
analyzed: gong bu dang 'dra bas na gong bu ste /
translated: The mass is like a mass,

original: de'i 'dod chags chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags chen po'o //
translated: that is, the great passion of that.

original: phat kyis 'byed pa ni chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phat kyis 'byed pa ni chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The splitting by phat is the separation from passion.

original: bden pa de la ni 'dod mi bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa de la ni 'dod mi bya ste /
translated: One should not desire that truth,

original: 'dod pa'i byed pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i byed pa med pa nyid do //
translated: because of the absence of the activity of desire.

original: rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being liberated from all conceptual thoughts.

original: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi yi ge h'um dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa la @89b thug pa'i bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi yi ge h'um dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa la @89b thug pa'i bzhi pa'o //
translated: And that is the fourth of the four joys culminating in the innate, of Vajrasattva himself, the syllable hum.

original: yang na aa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: yang na aa ni zla ba'o //
translated: Or else, a is the moon.

original: de'i phyir yi ge las byung ni h'um bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge las byung ni h'um bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, arising from the syllable is Vajradhara, inseparable from Vajranairatmya, the syllable hum.

original: de nyid phat kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: de nyid phat kyi yi ge'o //
translated: That itself is the syllable phat.🔽One should not desire that,

original: 'dod mi bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dod mi bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: because of the absence of the activity of desire.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag dbyer med par mdor bstan pa de rgyas par bshad pas rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag dbyer med par mdor bstan pa de rgyas par bshad pas rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The mandala of pristine awareness and the mandala of sacred commitment are clearly taught as inseparable.

original: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
translated: The mandala that arises from the reflection of the bodhisattva

original: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgom //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgom // zhes pa la /
translated: is meditated on as the lord of the mandala.

original: sems dpa'i sgras a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi zla ba dang nyi ma'i nang du son pa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: sems dpa'i sgras a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi zla ba dang nyi ma'i nang du son pa'i sa bon te /
translated: The term bodhisattva refers to the seed syllable located within the moon and sun, which are the nature of the two series of vowels and consonants.

original: srid gsum gcig pa sems pa nyid kyis na sems pa'o //
analyzed: srid gsum gcig pa sems pa nyid kyis na sems pa'o //
translated: It is a bodhisattva because it is the mind that is the unity of the three existences.

original: de bas na de'i bdag nyid kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gzugs brnyan lta bur gyur pa chu'i zla ba lta bu bden pa dang mi bden pa rnam par bcad nas /
analyzed: de bas na de'i bdag nyid kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gzugs brnyan lta bur gyur pa chu'i zla ba lta bu bden pa dang mi bden pa rnam par bcad nas /
translated: Therefore, it is the reflection-like nature of the utterly pure realm of reality, like the moon in the water, which is neither true nor false.

original: 'das pa sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan de las byung ba'o //
translated: The mandala that arises from that reflection of the bodhisattva is the past.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor bdag po ste dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor bdag po ste dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the lord of the mandala, the principal of the mandala.

original: rnam par bsgom ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsgom ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the meditative stabilization of the mandala circle, which is the cause of the accomplishment of the desired aim, by means of the various methods of meditation.

original: yang na sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba gang de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ye shes tha mi dad pa'i snying po len pa'o ;
analyzed: yang na sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba gang de nyid dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ye shes tha mi dad pa'i snying po len pa'o ;
translated: Or else, that which arises from the reflection of the Bodhisattva is the essence of the mandala lord, who is not different from the gnosis.

original: / de rnam par bsgom pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bar rnam par bsgom zhing /
analyzed: / de rnam par bsgom pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bar rnam par bsgom zhing /
translated: Its meditation is the meditation of the innate bliss.

original: gsal por bsgom par bya ba shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal por bsgom par bya ba shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: It should be meditated upon clearly, and is established as the nature of the completely pure dharmadhatu.🔽What is the superiority of that mandala lord?

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de cis khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po de cis khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: phyag mtshan la sogs gong ma bzhin /
analyzed: phyag mtshan la sogs gong ma bzhin /
translated: The hand implements and so forth are as before.

original: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
analyzed: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
translated: The light of the moon, crystal, and jewels

original: sngar gyi rnams dang 'dra bas na sngar gyi bzhin te phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / bcu drug pa rnams kyi rim par byed pa gnyis par zhabs bzhi pa /
analyzed: sngar gyi rnams dang 'dra bas na sngar gyi bzhin te phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / bcu drug pa rnams kyi rim par byed pa gnyis par zhabs bzhi pa /
translated: Since they are like the previous ones, they are the same as the previous ones, that is, the four-armed, six-armed, and sixteen-armed [forms].

original: zhal brgyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa dang / rim par phye ba gsum par phyag bzhi pa bdud bzhi'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyag drug pa zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang de nyid do //
analyzed: zhal brgyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa dang / rim par phye ba gsum par phyag bzhi pa bdud bzhi'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du phyag drug pa zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang de nyid do //
translated: The second stage is the four-footed, eight-faced, and so on, and the third stage is the four-armed, pure of the four māras, and so on, and likewise the six-armed, three-faced, and so on.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i zhal dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa gar mkhan la sogs pas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i zhal dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa gar mkhan la sogs pas mtshan pa'o //
translated: The faces, hand implements, and so on, are marked with dancers and so on.

original: 'on kyang / zla ba chu shel @90a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang / zla ba chu shel @90a * //
translated: However, the moon, water crystal,

original: nor bu'i 'od //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od //
translated: and the light of the jewel

original: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i rgyu rdo rje 'chang nyid kyi phyir rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog dkar po'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i rgyu rdo rje 'chang nyid kyi phyir rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang rtsa ba'i zhal dang sku mdog dkar po'o //
translated: are the cause of the reflection of the sattva, which is the cause Vajradhara. Therefore, the root face and body color of the causal Vajradhara are white.

original: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang ni sku mdog nag po yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang ni sku mdog nag po yin no //
translated: The result Vajradhara is black.

original: yang na gong ma bzhin ni ji ltar sngar chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma'i nang du son pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: yang na gong ma bzhin ni ji ltar sngar chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro'i steng du zla ba dang nyi ma'i nang du son pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Or else, as above, just as previously the seed is on the top of the flavor syllable of the nature of the dharmadhatu, within the moon and sun,

original: de bzhin du zhal brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal brjod pa yin te /
translated: so too is the face described.

original: brjod pa ni n'a da tshar gnyis phyag mtshan dang sa bon yin pas zhal mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni n'a da tshar gnyis phyag mtshan dang sa bon yin pas zhal mtshon pa'o //
translated: The description is the two sets of nada, the hand implements, and the seed, so the face is indicated.

original: 'di gsum ka dang po gzod ma nas rgyu med pa de'i rgyu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'di gsum ka dang po gzod ma nas rgyu med pa de'i rgyu rnams kyis so //
translated: All three of these are from the beginning without cause, and they are the causes of that.

original: gang zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gang zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The moon is the bodhicitta.

original: ka bde ba'o //
analyzed: ka bde ba'o //
translated: Ka is bliss.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pas na zla ba chu shel lo //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pas na zla ba chu shel lo //
translated: Since both are inseparable, the moon is water crystal.

original: nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang 'dra bar sna tshogs gzugs can gyi nor bu ji lta bar 'od 'bar zhing 'od gsal ba nyid gang de ni zla ba chu shel nir bu'i 'od do //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang 'dra bar sna tshogs gzugs can gyi nor bu ji lta bar 'od 'bar zhing 'od gsal ba nyid gang de ni zla ba chu shel nir bu'i 'od do //
translated: The light of the jewel is like a jewel. Just as a jewel has various forms, so the blazing light and luminosity is the light of the moon, water crystal, and jewel.

original: da ni kha sbyor du bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni kha sbyor du bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the summary of the union is stated:

original: 'di ltar thams cad rdzogs pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad rdzogs pa nyid //
translated: In this way, everything is complete.

original: 'di lta bu'i rim pas me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro thams cad nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rim pas me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro thams cad nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, by this process, all the tathagatas and all the dakinis are complete in the nature of the five wisdoms, such as the mirror-like wisdom.

original: yang na de ltar mkha' 'gro ma thams cad nyid rdzogs pa rnams de ltar yin no //
analyzed: yang na de ltar mkha' 'gro ma thams cad nyid rdzogs pa rnams de ltar yin no //
translated: Or, in this way, all the dakinis are complete in that way.

original: don 'di nyid rgyas par bshad pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid rgyas par bshad pa /
translated: This very meaning is explained extensively:

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las //🔽zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las // zhes pa ste ;
translated: From the nature of method and wisdom.

original: / yi ge ae shes rab la /
analyzed: / yi ge ae shes rab la /
translated: The letter e is wisdom.

original: yi ge wam gyis thabs te rang bzhin 'dis so //
analyzed: yi ge wam gyis thabs te rang bzhin 'dis so //
translated: The letter vam is method. By this nature,

original: de nyid shes rab a'a li zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab a'a li zhes brjod do //
translated: that very [nature] is called the ali of wisdom.

original: de nyid k'a li thabs yin no //
analyzed: de nyid k'a li thabs yin no //
translated: That very [nature] is the kali of method.

original: a'a li zla ba la k'a li nyi ma 'di dbyer med pa'i phyir yi ge ae dang yi ge wam thams dang shes rab de dag las kyang a'a li k'a li zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dir khyad par du dbye ba /
analyzed: a'a li zla ba la k'a li nyi ma 'di dbyer med pa'i phyir yi ge ae dang yi ge wam thams dang shes rab de dag las kyang a'a li k'a li zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dir khyad par du dbye ba /
translated: Because the ali moon and the kali sun are inseparable here, the letter e and the letter vam, and also the wisdoms, are the ali and kali moon and sun.

original: rab tu gsal ba'i shin tu gsal ba'i khya par de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i shin tu gsal ba'i khya par de'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the distinction of being very clear, extremely clear.

original: yang na 'di ltar thams cad rdzogs pa nyid kyi /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar thams cad rdzogs pa nyid kyi /
translated: Or else, in this way, everything is complete.

original: 'di ltar ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems gang de'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems gang de'o //
translated: In this way, that is, the enlightenment mind of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: thams cad ni thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Everything is the all-pervading Vajradhara.

original: aa bdag med ma'o ;
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o ;
translated: A is Nairātmya.

original: / de ltar thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: / de ltar thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
translated: Thus, Nairātmya is inseparable from the all-pervading Vajradhara.

original: de nyid rdzogs pa ni ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de nyid rdzogs pa ni ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: That itself is complete, having the nature of the totality of gnosis.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang gi phyir aa tsheg drag gi mtha' can no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir aa tsheg drag gi mtha' can no //
translated: Because it ends with the visarga, Aḥ.

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin las te shes rab ces pa ni bdag med @90b ma'o ;
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin las te shes rab ces pa ni bdag med @90b ma'o ;
translated: That itself is from the nature of method and wisdom. Wisdom is Nairātmya.

original: / thabs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: / thabs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Method is Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin las ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid las so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang bzhin las ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid las so //
translated: From the nature of both is from the nature of both.

original: gnyi ga yang a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis po de dbyer med pa'i phyir cha med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis po de dbyer med pa'i phyir cha med pa yin no //
translated: Both are partless because the two sets of vowels and consonants are inseparable.

original: de nas yang zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de nas yang zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Then, the moon is the mind of enlightenment.

original: nyi ma ni nyi ma ste cha shas med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes so //🔽gnyi ga rab dbye bas ni gzhan du na med pas te /
analyzed: nyi ma ni nyi ma ste cha shas med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes so // gnyi ga rab dbye bas ni gzhan du na med pas te /
translated: The sun is the sun, the gnosis of great bliss without parts.🔽The division of both is the fourth, Vajradhara, because it is not elsewhere,

original: rab tu gsal bar rang bzhin med par byas pa'i phyir bzhi pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar rang bzhin med par byas pa'i phyir bzhi pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: and because it makes the nature of the clear light disappear.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Thus is the joy.

original: thabs dang shes rab ces pa ni mchog dga'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ces pa ni mchog dga'o //
translated: Method and wisdom is the supreme joy.

original: a'a li k'a li zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The vowels and consonants are the pure joy.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye bas //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye bas //
translated: The division of the moon and sun

original: zhes pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: is the fourth, the innate joy.

original: 'di ltar dkar mo sogs 'di'i phyir kha dog dbye ba so so yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar dkar mo sogs 'di'i phyir kha dog dbye ba so so yin /
translated: Thus, because of this, the colors of this one, Gaurī, and so on, are individually different.

original: 'di'i phyir ni rgyu 'di'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir ni rgyu 'di'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of this, for this reason.

original: goo r'i la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rim par gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rim par gnas pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The dakinis are the pure objects of form, etc.

original: dkar mo la sogs pa rnams kyi mdog ni nag po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs pa rnams kyi mdog ni nag po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The colors of the white, etc., are black, etc.

original: dbye ba ni rab tu dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: dbye ba ni rab tu dbye ba nyid do //
translated: The divisions are the very divisions.

original: so so ni sna tshogs te sna tshogs pa'i mdog gang de mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: so so ni sna tshogs te sna tshogs pa'i mdog gang de mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The individual is the variety, and that which has a variety of colors is the dakini.

original: kha dog dbye ba zhes pa ni sa bon gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: kha dog dbye ba zhes pa ni sa bon gyi bye brag go //
translated: The division of colors is the difference of the seed.

original: gnas so so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnas so so zhes pa ni /
translated: The individual places are

original: so so so so'i sa bon las gang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: so so so so'i sa bon las gang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa'o //
translated: the individual seeds from which the dakinis, etc., are generated.

original: yang na dkar mo la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na dkar mo la sogs pa ni /
translated: Or else, the white, etc.,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbyer med pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbyer med pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: are the arising of the Tathagatas and the dakinis as inseparable.

original: gzhan ni mchog go //
analyzed: gzhan ni mchog go //
translated: The other is the supreme.

original: 'di nyid kha dog rnams kyi dbye ba dngos po med par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kha dog rnams kyi dbye ba dngos po med par bsdu ba'o //
translated: This very one is the collection of the divisions of the colors as non-existent things.

original: so so ni de nyid spro ba'o //
analyzed: so so ni de nyid spro ba'o //
translated: The individual is the very emanation.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: By that identity of emanation and gathering, the two maṇḍalas, which have the nature of the two truths, are inseparable.

original: de nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni /🔽re zhig nang gi 'phar ma la /
analyzed: de nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni / re zhig nang gi 'phar ma la /
translated: That is clarified:

original: rnal 'byor ma lnga nges gnas pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma lnga nges gnas pa //
translated: The five yoginīs are definitely located in the inner courtyard.

original: nang gi sgras bdag nyid gang gi dbang du byas pa'i gang gi rim pa de ni nang rim pa de ni rim mo //
analyzed: nang gi sgras bdag nyid gang gi dbang du byas pa'i gang gi rim pa de ni nang rim pa de ni rim mo //
translated: The inner courtyard is the one that is in the order of the one who is taken as the master.

original: de la re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa ste /
translated: The word “first” is the order.

original: phyi nas phyi rol gyi rim pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nas phyi rol gyi rim pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the outer courtyard will be explained later,

original: gnas pa zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i phyir gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i phyir gcig gi tshig go //
translated: “located” is the word for one because of being inseparable.

original: nges pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: “Definitely” is the definitive meaning.

original: rnal 'byor ma lnga ni me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //🔽de @91a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma lnga ni me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o // de @91a * //
translated: The five yoginīs are endowed with the yoga of the five gnoses, such as the mirror-like gnosis, and so on.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: How is that meditated on?

original: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The five aggregates are the nature of the five buddhas.

original: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bsgom //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bsgom //
translated: The yogin, knowing reality, always meditates.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should enter into union with the nature of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnal 'byor rig pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pa ste /
translated: The yogin, knowing reality.

original: gnyis su med pa khong du chud cing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa khong du chud cing rtogs pa'o //
translated: He is one who has understood and realized nonduality.

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Always means by uninterrupted continuity.

original: yang na nang gi 'phar ma zhes pa ni bdag nyid lhag par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na nang gi 'phar ma zhes pa ni bdag nyid lhag par gnas pa ste /
translated: Or else, the inner courtyard is the abode of the self.

original: bdag nyid gnas pa gang gi 'phar ma de ni 'phar ma'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas pa gang gi 'phar ma de ni 'phar ma'o //
translated: That courtyard in which the self abides is the courtyard.

original: de la re zhig gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig gnas pa ni /
translated: There, first, the abode is

original: rba rlabs med pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: rba rlabs med pa'i tshul can no //
translated: the state without waves.

original: nges pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The certain is the certain.

original: cis khyad par 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par 'phags she na /
translated: By what is it distinguished?

original: rnal 'byor ma lnga po zhes pa ni me long la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma lnga po zhes pa ni me long la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The five yoginis are the five yogas of the mirror and so forth.

original: 'dis ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyi ga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of both.

original: bdag med ma dang mkha' 'gro ma de nyid phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma dang mkha' 'gro ma de nyid phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis ni me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis ni me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Their nature is the five gnoses of mirror and so on, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas Vairochana and so on.

original: bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: Meditation is the meditative equipoise.

original: rnal 'byor rig ni gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs shing khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig ni gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs shing khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The yogi/ni is one who knows and realizes the indivisibility of the two.

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Always means without interruption.

original: nang gi 'phar ma la gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga bstan pa ni /🔽dbang por rdo rje ni /
analyzed: nang gi 'phar ma la gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga bstan pa ni / dbang por rdo rje ni /
translated: The five dakinis who dwell in the inner courtyard are taught.

original: shar gyi 'dab ma la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: shar gyi 'dab ma la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Vajra in Indra is Vajra-dakini on the eastern petal.

original: gshin rje ni lho'i 'dab ma la dkar mo'o //
analyzed: gshin rje ni lho'i 'dab ma la dkar mo'o //
translated: Yama in the south is Sitata-parna on the southern petal.

original: chu bdag ni nub kyi 'dab ma la chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: chu bdag ni nub kyi 'dab ma la chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Varuna in the west is Varuna-yogini on the western petal.

original: lus ngan ni byang gi 'dab ma la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: lus ngan ni byang gi 'dab ma la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Kubera in the north is Vajra-dakini on the northern petal.

original: dbus su ni dbus kyi lte ba la rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: dbus su ni dbus kyi lte ba la rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
translated: In the center is Yoginī Nairātmya in the center of the hub.

original: yang na dbang por rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na dbang por rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: Alternatively, “vajra in the sense organ”

original: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
translated: is the aggregate of form as Vajrā.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis te kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis te kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of the universal illumination” is the vajra of body.

original: gshin rje dkar ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyis dkar mo ste /🔽tshor ba la ni dkar mor bshad //
analyzed: gshin rje dkar ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin gyis dkar mo ste / tshor ba la ni dkar mor bshad //
translated: “White in the Lord of Death” is Śvetā, whose nature is feeling.

original: ces pas so //
analyzed: ces pas so //
translated: The phrase “feeling is explained as white”

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: is the vajra of mind, the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: lus ngan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: lus ngan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: “Kāyavaktravajraḍākinī”

original: zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni //
translated: is the phrase

original: 'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma //🔽zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma // zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: “perception is the Yoginī of water.”

original: mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The nature of the aggregate of perception is the vajra of speech, because it is the nature of the manifest.

original: lus ngan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: lus ngan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: “Kāyavaktravajraḍākinī”

original: zhes @91b pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis 'du byed kyi phung po chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin des /
analyzed: zhes @91b pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis 'du byed kyi phung po chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin des /
translated: is the aggregate of formation, the nature of the realm of phenomena, by the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: rdo rje yang de mkha' 'gro ma yang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje yang de mkha' 'gro ma yang yin pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since she is a vajra and also a dakini, she is the nature of the indivisible vajra dakini.

original: d'a nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: d'a nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: Da means space, and

original: de'i sku yin pas na nges par bstan pas mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i sku yin pas na nges par bstan pas mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
translated: since she is the body of that, she is taught as the dakini of the indivisible three vajras, the pristine consciousness of Vajradhara.

original: dbus su bdag med rnal 'byor ma //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbus su bdag med rnal 'byor ma // zhes pa ni /
translated: In the center is Nairatmya Yogini.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pas dbu ma ste bar ma'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pas dbu ma ste bar ma'o //
translated: Since she is beyond the concepts of bliss and so on, she is the middle because she is nonconceptual.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor ma bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //🔽re zhig gi smra /
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor ma bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to // re zhig gi smra /
translated: Since she is liberated from the apprehension of I and mine, she is called Yogini of the Two Non-apprehended Realities, meaning the indivisibility of the two truths.

original: rim pa la ltos pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rim pa la ltos pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma brgyad bstan pa ni /
translated: Now then, the eight dakinis who reside in the outer enclosure are taught in dependence on the stages.

original: phyi rol gyi ni 'phar ma la //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni 'phar ma la //
translated: In the outer enclosure,

original: dkar mo chom rkun ro langs ma //
analyzed: dkar mo chom rkun ro langs ma //
translated: Gaurī, Caurī, Vetālī,

original: gha sma r'i dang pukka s'i /
analyzed: gha sma r'i dang pukka s'i /
translated: Ghasmarī and Pukkasī,

original: ri khrod ma dang gdol pa ma //
analyzed: ri khrod ma dang gdol pa ma //
translated: Śavarī and Caṇḍālī,

original: brgyad pa dombi n'i ru brjod //🔽phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la ni shar gyi 'dab mar dkar mo /
analyzed: brgyad pa dombi n'i ru brjod // phyi rol gyi 'phar ma la ni shar gyi 'dab mar dkar mo /
translated: the eighth is said to be Ḍombinī.🔽On the outer peristyle, on the petal in the east is Gaurī,

original: lho'i 'dab ma la chom rkun ma /
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma la chom rkun ma /
translated: on the petal in the south is Caurī,

original: nub kyi 'dab ma la ro langs ma /🔽byang gi 'dab ma la za phod ma /🔽dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la pukka s'i /
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma la ro langs ma / byang gi 'dab ma la za phod ma / dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la pukka s'i /
translated: on the petal in the west is Vetālī,🔽on the petal in the north is Ghasmarī,🔽on the petal in the northeast is Pukkasī,

original: me'i 'dab ma la ri khrod ma /🔽bden bral gyi 'dab ma la gtum mo /
analyzed: me'i 'dab ma la ri khrod ma / bden bral gyi 'dab ma la gtum mo /
translated: on the petal in the southeast is Śavarī,🔽on the petal in the southwest is Caṇḍālī,

original: rlung gi phyogs kyi 'dab ma la g-yung mo'o //
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs kyi 'dab ma la g-yung mo'o //
translated: and on the petal in the northwest is Ḍombinī.

original: 'og ldan ma dang steng ldan nyid //
analyzed: 'og ldan ma dang steng ldan nyid //
translated: The lower and upper,

original: mkha' spyod ma dang sa spyod 'dod //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma dang sa spyod 'dod //
translated: the celestial and terrestrial, are desired.

original: 'og gi sgras padma gnyi ga'i rtse mo dang // rtsa ba dag tu 'og gi sa spyod ma'o //🔽de bzhin du mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: 'og gi sgras padma gnyi ga'i rtse mo dang // rtsa ba dag tu 'og gi sa spyod ma'o // de bzhin du mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: By the word “lower” the lower celestial and terrestrial are in the tips and roots of both lotuses.

original: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Similarly, the upper celestial and terrestrial are in the tips and roots of both lotuses.

original: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
translated: These are the abodes of great compassion,🔽by the nature of existence and peace.

original: sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i rnam pa mkha' 'gro ma gnyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i rnam pa mkha' 'gro ma gnyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The two dakinis, the earth-dwelling and the sky-dwelling, abide in the nature of cyclic life and perfect peace.

original: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag kyang ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin 'di dag kyang ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gnas so //
translated: These natures of cyclic life and perfect peace are also present in the form of pristine awareness.

original: snying rje che zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje che zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The Tibetan word che is a vocative particle.

original: phyi rol gyi ni 'phar ma la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni 'phar ma la /
translated: In the outer courtyard,

original: dkar mo zhes pa ni /🔽gzugs la goo r'ir rtag tu bshad //
analyzed: dkar mo zhes pa ni / gzugs la goo r'ir rtag tu bshad //
translated: the white one is said to be Gauri.

original: ces pas gzugs ni kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir sku rdo rje dga' ba dang po'o //
analyzed: ces pas gzugs ni kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir sku rdo rje dga' ba dang po'o //
translated: Since form is characterized by universal illumination, it is the vajra body, the first joy.

original: sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags //
analyzed: sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags //
translated: The sound is renowned as Chauri.

original: zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje mchog dga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje mchog dga'o //
translated: Since speech is the supreme vajra, it is the second joy.

original: dri yi yul la ro langs ma //🔽zhes pa ni dri ni rig pa ste @92a * //
analyzed: dri yi yul la ro langs ma // zhes pa ni dri ni rig pa ste @92a * //
translated: The object of smell is Vetali.

original: thugs rdo rje rnam par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje rnam par dga' ba'o //
translated: Since smell is awareness, it is the vajra mind, the third joy.

original: ro ni za phod ma ru grags //
analyzed: ro ni za phod ma ru grags //
translated: Taste is renowned as Ghasmari.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis ro ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis ro ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the experience of the flavor of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: rin rin chen gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rin rin chen gtso bo'o //
translated: Ratna is the chief jewel.

original: sa ni byang chub kyi sems 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: sa ni byang chub kyi sems 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Bhūmi is the bodhicitta of Amitābha.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of the two is the fourth, connate Vajradhara.

original: sa ni pukka s'i zhes bshad //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'i zhes bshad // ces pa ni /
translated: Bhūmi is said to be Pukkasī.

original: gti mug rdo rje'i rnam par dag pas kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje'i rnam par dag pas kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Since she is the purity of Vajra Delusion, she is the vajra body, which has the nature of the universal illumination.

original: chu khams rngon pa ma ru 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams rngon pa ma ru 'dod //
translated: The water element is said to be Rūpiṇī.

original: ces pa ni chu ni 'od dpag tu med pa nyid kyis gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni chu ni 'od dpag tu med pa nyid kyis gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Since water is Amitābha, she is the vajra speech.

original: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
analyzed: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
translated: Fire is known to be Caṇḍālī.

original: zhes pa ni me ni rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me ni rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since fire is the cause of the absence of intrinsic existence,

original: yang na tsandan nyi ma'o //
analyzed: yang na tsandan nyi ma'o //
translated: or alternatively, since candana is the sun,

original: a'a li zla ba'o //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba'o //
translated: and āli is the moon,

original: gnyi ga 'di la yod pas gtum mo ste thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'di la yod pas gtum mo ste thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: both exist in her, and so she is the vajra mind.

original: g-yung mo ni gang la reg tu mi rung ba de ni g-yung mo'o //
analyzed: g-yung mo ni gang la reg tu mi rung ba de ni g-yung mo'o //
translated: The “witch” is one with whom it is improper to have contact.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: She is endowed with the intuition that is free from the subject-object dichotomy.

original: brgyad pa ni brgyad rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni brgyad rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The “eighth” is the completion of the eight.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir bzhi po gnyis te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir bzhi po gnyis te /
translated: The two sets of four are due to the purity of means and insight.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the joys, etc.

original: de bas na lha mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na lha mo brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, she is surrounded by the eight goddesses.

original: mkha' 'gro ma lngas ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma lngas ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag med ma'o //
translated: The five dakinis are the five intuitions, mirror-like intuition, etc., whose nature is Nairatmya.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas te dbyer med cing mi g-yo ba 'di dag ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das srid pa dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas te dbyer med cing mi g-yo ba 'di dag ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Blessed Lord is the nature of existence and peace, the indivisible and immutable intuition.

original: mkha' spyod dang sa spyod kyi sgras bdag med ma'i rang bzhin bstan pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: mkha' spyod dang sa spyod kyi sgras bdag med ma'i rang bzhin bstan pa las rdo rje 'dzin pa ni ma bstan to //
translated: The terms “celestial” and “terrestrial” refer to Nairatmya’s nature, but not to Vajradhara’s.

original: rnam dag bstan pa'i lhag mas pho rtags kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam dag bstan pa'i lhag mas pho rtags kyis bstan to //
translated: The remainder of the verse shows the male gender of Vajradhara.

original: de bas na rdo rje 'dzin pa bod pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje 'dzin pa bod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Tibetan Vajra Holder,

original: snying rje chen po zhes pas gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i lam shes kyi gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes pas gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i lam shes kyi gzhan du ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: with great compassion, knows the path of the inseparability of the two, and not otherwise.

original: gang du khams gsum rang bzhin med par rtog pa rnam par gnas pas 'gro ba'i don byed pas na snying rje chen po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang du khams gsum rang bzhin med par rtog pa rnam par gnas pas 'gro ba'i don byed pas na snying rje chen po nyid yin no //
translated: Where the three realms are realized to be essenceless, and one abides in that realization, and acts for the benefit of beings, that is great compassion.

original: 'di rnams kyi sa bon ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sa bon ni /
translated: The seed syllables of these are:

original: a'am aim a'im a'um aam /
analyzed: a'am aim a'im a'um aam /
translated: a, aṃ, aḥ, aḥ, aḥ.

original: rdo rje dkar mo chu ma dang // rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag med ma //
analyzed: rdo rje dkar mo chu ma dang // rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag med ma //
translated: Vajra-gaurī, Vāri-jā, Vajra-ḍākinī, Nairātmya,

original: zhes pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga'i sa bon rim pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga'i sa bon rim pas shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know the seed syllables of the five ḍākinīs in order.

original: lim aem aeem aoom dkar mo dang / chom kun ma dang / ro langs dang / za phod rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lim aem aeem aoom dkar mo dang / chom kun ma dang / ro langs dang / za phod rnams kyi'o //
translated: Liṃ, aṃ, āṃ, āḥ are the seed syllables of Gaurī, Cāmuṇḍā, Vetālī, and Pukkasī, respectively.

original: a'um rim r'im lim /
analyzed: a'um rim r'im lim /
translated: Ūṃ, riṃ, raṃ, liṃ

original: sbos mo dang / rngon pa ma dang / gtum mo dang / dombi @92b n'i rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sbos mo dang / rngon pa ma dang / gtum mo dang / dombi @92b n'i rnams kyi'o //
translated: are the seed syllables of Ghasmarī, Dombī, Canda, and Ḍombinī, respectively.

original: aom aam sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i yan no //
analyzed: aom aam sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i yan no //
translated: Aṃ, oṃ are the seed syllables of Bhūcariṇī and Khacarīṇī, respectively.

original: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma lnga'o //
translated: By this, the five dakinis are the five aggregates of form, etc., in their pure nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bzhi yongs su dag pa dkar mo la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bzhi yongs su dag pa dkar mo la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
translated: The four dakinis, white, etc., are the four objects of form, etc., in their pure nature.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi 'byung ba bzhi rnam par dag pa sbos mo la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi 'byung ba bzhi rnam par dag pa sbos mo la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
translated: The four dakinis, smoke, etc., are the four elements of earth, water, fire, and air in their pure nature.

original: yid kyi dam pa'i bde ba 'dzag / ces pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: yid kyi dam pa'i bde ba 'dzag / ces pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The verse, “The supreme bliss of the mind is flowing” (1.10),

original: sa spyod ma'i rnam par dag pa reg bya'i yul la /
analyzed: sa spyod ma'i rnam par dag pa reg bya'i yul la /
translated: is the purity of the earth-dwelling dakinis, the object of touch.

original: bde ba yang ni nam mkha'i khams //
analyzed: bde ba yang ni nam mkha'i khams //
translated: The verse, “The bliss is also the space element” (1.11),

original: zhes bas nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir mkha' spyod ma'i rnam par dag pa nam mkha'i khams yin no //
analyzed: zhes bas nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir mkha' spyod ma'i rnam par dag pa nam mkha'i khams yin no //
translated: is the purity of the sky-dwelling dakinis, the space element, because of the purity of the space element.

original: 'dis ni dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: By this, the wheel has the nature of the fifteen dakinis, who are the nature of the five sense faculties and the five elements.

original: mkha' spyod ma dang sa spyod ma 'di dag srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma dang sa spyod ma 'di dag srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pas thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: He is the Vajra Holder, whose nature is method and wisdom, by the purity of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga po rnams kyis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga po rnams kyis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the nature of the five aggregates, by the five dakinis such as Vajra Woman.

original: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bzhi dang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyi rang bzhin dgu'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bzhi dang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rnam par dag pas rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyi rang bzhin dgu'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: He is the Vajra Holder, whose nature is the nine dakinis, by the purity of the four objects such as form and the four great elements such as earth, by the eight yoginis such as White.

original: gnyi ga'i dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis yin te /
translated: He is the two mandalas, the indivisible mandala of both.

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor bas //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor bas //
translated: The union of Alikali

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi gdan //
translated: is the seat of Vajrasattva himself.

original: yi ge las byung gong bu la /
analyzed: yi ge las byung gong bu la /
translated: The syllable-born mass

original: h'um phat yi ge'ang 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: h'um phat yi ge'ang 'dod mi bya //
translated: is not desired to have the syllables hum and phat.

original: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
translated: The mandala lord arises from the reflection of the bodhisattva,

original: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgom //
translated: meditated as having the nature of the mandala.

original: phyag mtshan zhal sogs snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: phyag mtshan zhal sogs snga ma bzhin //
translated: The hand implements, faces, and so on are as before.

original: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
analyzed: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
translated: The light of the moon, crystal, and jewels

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las //
translated: arises from the nature of method and wisdom.

original: 'di rnams thams cad rdzogs pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad rdzogs pa nyid //
translated: All of these are perfected.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye bas //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye bas //
translated: The division of the moon and sun

original: a'a li shes rab k'a li thabs //
analyzed: a'a li shes rab k'a li thabs //
translated: is the vowels and consonants.

original: 'di ltar dkar mo sogs 'di'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkar mo sogs 'di'i phyir //
translated: Thus, the colors of Gaurī and so on are

original: kha dog dbye ba so so gzhan //
analyzed: kha dog dbye ba so so gzhan //
translated: individually different.

original: zhes pas dkyil 'khor gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis kha sbyor nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pas dkyil 'khor gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid kyis kha sbyor nyid do //
translated: Since the two mandalas are inseparable, they are united.

original: 'phar ma gnyis zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phar ma gnyis zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The two-storied is explained by the statement “two-storied.”

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad //🔽sku mdog @93a * //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma thams cad // sku mdog @93a * //
translated: All vajra dakinis🔽are black

original: nag mo drag chen mo //
analyzed: nag mo drag chen mo //
translated: and very wrathful.

original: phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan //
translated: They are adorned with the five symbolic ornaments,

original: zhal gcig spyan ni dmar po rnams //
analyzed: zhal gcig spyan ni dmar po rnams //
translated: have one face, and their eyes are red.

original: lag par gri gug thod pas brel //
analyzed: lag par gri gug thod pas brel //
translated: They hold flaying knives and skulls in their hands.

original: don ni gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don ni gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: yang na thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or else, all is the Vajra Holder.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is the Nairātmya.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes thams cad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes thams cad do //
translated: The gnosis of the inseparability of the two is all.

original: de nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: That itself is the Vajraḍāka.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the Vajra Holder.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Ḍāka is Nairātmya and so forth.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ye shes dang dbyer med pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ye shes dang dbyer med pa'i don to //
translated: This means the gnosis inseparable from the Vajraḍāka.

original: sku mdog ces pa ni 'dir nag po bsrabs pas yi ge a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis kyis de rnams kha dog gnag pa'i cha med pa'i rang bzhin gyi don to //
analyzed: sku mdog ces pa ni 'dir nag po bsrabs pas yi ge a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis kyis de rnams kha dog gnag pa'i cha med pa'i rang bzhin gyi don to //
translated: The color is here black, the meaning of which is the absence of the two garlands of vowels and consonants, which are the black part of those.

original: 'dis ni n'a da dang dbyer med pa nyid ye shes yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni n'a da dang dbyer med pa nyid ye shes yin no //
translated: This means that the gnosis is inseparable from the nāda.

original: drag mo zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: drag mo zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The fierce one is the bodhicitta of Māmakī.

original: ha ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ha ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Ha is the Vajra Holder.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i drag chen po gtum mo nyi ma'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i drag chen po gtum mo nyi ma'o //
translated: The great fierce one, the fierce sun, is the inseparability of the two.

original: drag po nyi ma de bzhin du yin la ma ni a'a li'i tshul zla ba'o //
analyzed: drag po nyi ma de bzhin du yin la ma ni a'a li'i tshul zla ba'o //
translated: The fierce one is the sun, and ma is the moon, the manner of the āli.

original: chen po'i rang bzhin yang yin la drag mo yang yin pas drag chen mo ste /
analyzed: chen po'i rang bzhin yang yin la drag mo yang yin pas drag chen mo ste /
translated: Since she is both great and fierce, she is the great fierce one.

original: snang ba snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid sku dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi ye shes yin te /
analyzed: snang ba snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid sku dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi ye shes yin te /
translated: The appearance that is the nature of nonappearance is the pristine consciousness that is inseparable from the kāya.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin gyis sku gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin gyis sku gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
translated: The pristine consciousness that is inseparable from the three kāyas is the pristine consciousness that is the nature of the reflection of the sattva.

original: phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga yis rnam par brgyan //
translated: Adorned with the five symbolic ornaments

original: zhes pa ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga nyid kyis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su brgyan cing spro ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga nyid kyis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su brgyan cing spro ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas so //
translated: The five pristine consciousnesses of the mirror and so on are the ornaments of the various forms that exist in the manner of emanation.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kho na ye shes yin no //🔽zhal gcig ces pa ni brjod pa yin pas na zhal lo ;
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kho na ye shes yin no // zhal gcig ces pa ni brjod pa yin pas na zhal lo ;
translated: Pristine consciousness itself is the nature of emanation and gathering.🔽Since the face is the expression, it is a face.

original: / gcig ni dbyer med pa la yod pa de ni zhal gcig pa ste cha med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / gcig ni dbyer med pa la yod pa de ni zhal gcig pa ste cha med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since the one is indivisible, it is the one face, the nature of the partless.

original: spyan ni dmar zhes pa ni dmar po ni 'dod chags chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyan ni dmar zhes pa ni dmar po ni 'dod chags chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eyes are red: red is the characteristic of passion, of attachment.

original: spyan ni dbang po rnams gang la yod pa de spyan dmar pa'o //
analyzed: spyan ni dbang po rnams gang la yod pa de spyan dmar pa'o //
translated: The eyes are the senses.

original: zhal gcig pas ni cha med pa yin la spyan dmar bas cha dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhal gcig pas ni cha med pa yin la spyan dmar bas cha dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Since he has one face, he is partless; since he has red eyes, he is partful.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pas 'di bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pas 'di bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Since he is the nature of both, he is the nature of the two truths.

original: gri gug ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: gri gug ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: The curved knife is Nairātmya;

original: thod pa ni rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: thod pa ni rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: the skull is Vajradhara.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis bden pa gnyis bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis bden pa gnyis bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: By the nature of the two truths, the two truths are Nairātmya and Vajradhara.

original: de nyid phyag ste /
analyzed: de nyid phyag ste /
translated: That itself is the hand.

original: ka rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ka rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Ka is Vajradhara;

original: ra bdag @93b med ma'o //
analyzed: ra bdag @93b med ma'o //
translated: ra is Nairātmya.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir phyag yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir phyag yin no //
translated: Since the two are inseparable, it is the hand.

original: phyag rgya lnga nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga nyid bstan pa /
translated: The five symbolic ornaments are taught:🔽The wheel, earrings, necklace,

original: 'khor lo rna cha mgul rgyan dang // lag par lag gdub skye rags ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo rna cha mgul rgyan dang // lag par lag gdub skye rags ni //
translated: armlets, and belt

original: sangs rgyas lnga yi rnam dag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga yi rnam dag pa'o //
translated: are the purities of the five buddhas.

original: 'di lnga phyag rgya dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lnga phyag rgya dag pa'o //
translated: These five are the pure seals.

original: zhes pas me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yin par gang gsungs pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yin par gang gsungs pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of what was stated as being the nature of the five intuitions, such as the mirror intuition, etc.

original: 'di thams cad nyid dbyer med pa'i ye shes yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad nyid dbyer med pa'i ye shes yin par gsungs pa /
translated: It is stated that all of this is the intuition of the indivisibility of all things:

original: ji ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
translated: As is the Yoginī Nairātmya,

original: de ltar thams cad rnam par bshad //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad rnam par bshad //
translated: so is everything explained.

original: thams cad nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: Everything is the ḍākinī,

original: de ltar rnam par ni de lta bu'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par ni de lta bu'i rnam par ro //
translated: and so is everything explained.

original: 'di ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med rnal 'byor ma ni /
translated: In this way, the Yoginī Nairātmya

original: bdag med mkha' 'gro ma dang 'dra ba nyid du mkha' 'gro ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med mkha' 'gro ma dang 'dra ba nyid du mkha' 'gro ma yin no //
translated: is the ḍākinī, who is like the ḍākinī Nairātmyā.

original: lag pa gcig ni thod pas brel //
analyzed: lag pa gcig ni thod pas brel //
translated: One hand is occupied with a skull,

original: phyag g-yon pa thod pas brel ba'o //🔽g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa thod pas brel ba'o // g-yas pa na ni gri gug 'dzin //
translated: the left hand is occupied with a skull.🔽The right hand holds a flaying knife,🔽and the right side is the flaying knife.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis dang // g-yon pa kha tv'am ga nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis dang // g-yon pa kha tv'am ga nyid do //
