translated: This is the extensive explanation by the four lines beginning with “The slight joy is bliss.”🔽The desire to touch is the supreme joy.

original: dang po reg par 'dod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhis shin tu rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dang po reg par 'dod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhis shin tu rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the very extensive explanation by the four lines beginning with “The desire to touch is the supreme joy.”

original: mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba srid par brjod //
translated: The supreme joy is said to be existence.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhis 'jug bsdu pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhis 'jug bsdu pa ste /
translated: This is the summary by the four lines beginning with “The supreme joy is said to be existence.”

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug gi bdag nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The innate pristine awareness is the nature of the sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa'i dga' ba gsum ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa'i dga' ba gsum ni /
translated: Therefore, the three joys of the teaching, etc.,🔽are dependent on the connate.

original: lhan cig skyes pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin des na mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin par des gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin des na mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin par des gsungs pa /
translated: Since they are inseparable from that connate nature, they are not objects with signs, not objects of consciousness that has the nature of subject and object.

original: gzhan gyis brjod min lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod min lhan cig skyes //
translated: The connate cannot be expressed by others.

original: gang du yang ni mi rnyed de //🔽bla ma'i dus nyer bsten pa yis //
analyzed: gang du yang ni mi rnyed de // bla ma'i dus nyer bsten pa yis //
translated: It is not found anywhere.🔽It should be known from one’s own merit

original: bdag gis bsod nams las shes bya //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams las shes bya //
translated: through close reliance on the guru.

original: lhan cig skyes pa gzhan su yis kyang smra bar mi nus te ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang du yang dngos po mi rnyed de /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa gzhan su yis kyang smra bar mi nus te ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro // gang du yang dngos po mi rnyed de /
translated: The connate cannot be expressed by others because it is beyond the domain of speech.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not found anywhere because it is utterly beyond the domain of subject and object.

original: bdag gis shes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis shes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: It should be known from one’s own merit, that is, it should be realized by oneself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsod nams las bsod nams kyi tshogs las so //
analyzed: bsod nams las bsod nams kyi tshogs las so //
translated: from the accumulation of merit.

original: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir /🔽bla ma'i dus tshigs bsten pa las 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir / bla ma'i dus tshigs bsten pa las 'gyur te /
translated: For this very reason,🔽it arises from the service of the guru,

original: bla ma brgyud pa bsten pa las yin no //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pa bsten pa las yin no //
translated: from the service of the lineage of gurus.

original: de nas des bstan pa la yang bla ma'i bka' drin las khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas des bstan pa la yang bla ma'i bka' drin las khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, from the guru's kindness, one will understand the teaching.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs las ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs las ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the accumulation of wisdom is taught from the accumulation of merit.

original: yang na rang gis shes bya ni bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rang gis shes bya ni bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Or, self-cognizance is one's own experience.

original: rang gis nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of one's own experience is co-emergence.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir rang rig pa yang stong pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir rang rig pa yang stong pa yin no //
translated: Self-awareness is also empty, because it is contradictory for it to act on itself.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de rnam par shes pa'i yang spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de rnam par shes pa'i yang spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: That co-emergence is not the domain of consciousness.

original: de ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs las shin tu 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar sku dang gsung dang thugs las shin tu 'das pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is beyond body, speech, and mind.

original: 'od ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'od ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is its light like?

original: bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs las bla ma'i dus nye bar bsten pas /
analyzed: bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi tshogs las bla ma'i dus nye bar bsten pas /
translated: Merit is the accumulation of merit, which is the proper reliance on the guru at the time of the disciple.

original: bla ma'i rim pa goms pa nyid des na rim pa lnga'i mngon par byang chub pa dang bral na yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bla ma'i rim pa goms pa nyid des na rim pa lnga'i mngon par byang chub pa dang bral na yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Since that is the case, if one is devoid of the manifest enlightenment of the five stages, the authentic reality will not arise.

original: dang por gnang ba de yang 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dang por gnang ba de yang 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, first, the permission is free from the eight worldly concerns.

original: de nas yang gnas pa ni de las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang gnas pa ni de las ldog pa'o //
translated: Then, the abiding is the opposite of that.

original: de ji ltar zhe @100a * //
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe @100a * //
translated: How is that?

original: na ; /'di lta bu'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: na ; /'di lta bu'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
translated: The gnosis of the indivisible conventional and ultimate arises.

original: rim pa ni rim pa 'dis ni bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa ni rim pa 'dis ni bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The stage is the generation by this stage.

original: de nas man ngag ni /
analyzed: de nas man ngag ni /
translated: Then, the intimate instruction

original: gang de bskyed par bya ba'i ye shes de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang de bskyed par bya ba'i ye shes de nyid yin no //
translated: is the gnosis that is to be generated.

original: 'di thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi thabs dag khyad la gtad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi thabs dag khyad la gtad pa yin no //
translated: All of this is the special method for the siddhi of mahāmudrā.

original: khyod kyis kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du 'gro ba'i don bskyed pa'i phyir dad pa'i stobs dang // dran pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / ye shes kyi stobs rnams mi spang bar bya ba ni yang dag par blangs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du 'gro ba'i don bskyed pa'i phyir dad pa'i stobs dang // dran pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs dang / ye shes kyi stobs rnams mi spang bar bya ba ni yang dag par blangs pa'o //
translated: You should not abandon the power of faith, the power of mindfulness, the power of diligence, the power of wisdom, and the power of knowledge for the sake of generating the welfare of beings until you reach the essence of enlightenment. This is the correct undertaking.

original: de ltar gnang ba dang gnas pa dang / rim pa dang / gdams ngag dang / yang dag par blangs pa dang / rim pa lnga rnams ni bstan bcos kyi dka' drin las mchog tu bstan pa yin te //
analyzed: de ltar gnang ba dang gnas pa dang / rim pa dang / gdams ngag dang / yang dag par blangs pa dang / rim pa lnga rnams ni bstan bcos kyi dka' drin las mchog tu bstan pa yin te //
translated: Thus, the five stages of permission, abiding, sequence, instruction, and correct undertaking are taught in the treatise as supreme.

original: bstan bcos kyi bka' drin nyid las yang dag pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu gzhan bstan pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi bka' drin nyid las yang dag pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu gzhan bstan pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the kindness of the treatise, there is no other cause for the supreme, correct wisdom.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin kho na so so'i sde ba sbyor gyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin kho na so so'i sde ba sbyor gyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The innate nature arises through the application of each section.

original: dman dang 'bring dang mchog rnams dang // gzhan dang gang rnams de rnams kyang //
analyzed: dman dang 'bring dang mchog rnams dang // gzhan dang gang rnams de rnams kyang //
translated: and the others, whatever they are,🔽are all seen as the same

original: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pa yis //
translated: by the meditation on that sameness.

original: 'di kun mnyam pa nyid du blta //
analyzed: 'di kun mnyam pa nyid du blta //
translated: All this is seen as the same.

original: dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
analyzed: dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
translated: The inferior is the meaning of subtlety.

original: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
analyzed: mchog ni dngos por brjod par bya //
translated: The superior is said to be substance.

original: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid //
analyzed: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid //
translated: The middle is the abandonment of both.🔽The others are said to be the six sense faculties.

original: gzhan rnams zhes bya dbang po drug / gang rnams de rnams brtan g-yo bas //
analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes bya dbang po drug / gang rnams de rnams brtan g-yo bas //
translated: Whatever they are, they are all moving and unmoving.

original: 'di kun zhes bya nga nyid med //
analyzed: 'di kun zhes bya nga nyid med //
translated: All this is said to be me, without an “I.”

original: dman pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dman pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the brief presentation of the inferior and so forth.

original: dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
analyzed: dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
translated: The inferior is the meaning of subtlety.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab go //
translated: This is wisdom.

original: dngos por brjod par bya zhes pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: dngos por brjod par bya zhes pa ni thabs so //
translated: Substance is said to be method.

original: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: The middle is the abandonment of both. This is the gnosis that is the nature of the three vajras, the indivisibility of method and wisdom.

original: dbang po drug ces pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dbang po drug ces pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The six senses are the gnosis of the sixth, the Vajra Holder.

original: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo ni bsdu ba dang spro ba'i bdag nyid de yin no //
analyzed: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo ni bsdu ba dang spro ba'i bdag nyid de yin no //
translated: Those are the essence of the gathering and emanation of the stable and the moving.

original: 'di kun zhes pa ni thams cad nyid ye shes kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: 'di kun zhes pa ni thams cad nyid ye shes kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: All of this is the nature of gnosis.

original: nga nyid med ni nga med pa nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: nga nyid med ni nga med pa nyid med pa ste /
translated: I am not nonexistent, not nonexistent,

original: mtha' dag bsdu pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: mtha' dag bsdu pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: the essence of the gathering of all, gnosis.

original: yang na / dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
analyzed: yang na / dman pa gnas ni phra ba'i don //
translated: Or, the abode of the inferior is the subtle object.

original: zhes pa ni dga' ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dga' ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of joy.

original: mchog ni dngos @100b por brjod par bya ni mchog dga' ye shes so //
analyzed: mchog ni dngos @100b por brjod par bya ni mchog dga' ye shes so //
translated: The supreme is to be expressed as the object, the gnosis of supreme joy.

original: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid //
analyzed: dbu ma gnyis kyis spangs pa nyid //
translated: The middle is abandoned by both.

original: ces pa ni rnam par dga' ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa ni rnam par dga' ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of separation.

original: gzhan rnams zhes bya dbang po drug / ces pa ni gzhan 'di rnams yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams zhes bya dbang po drug / ces pa ni gzhan 'di rnams yin te /
translated: The others are the six senses.

original: 'di rnams kyis thams cad dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis thams cad dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: They are all the indivisible gnosis of the connate.

original: drug po rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid de nyid spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: drug po rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid de nyid spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The six are the nature of the five intuitions of the vajra-holder, and are the nature of emanation and gathering.

original: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
analyzed: gang rnams de rnams brtan dang g-yo //
translated: All these, moving and unmoving,

original: 'di kun zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di kun zhes pa ni dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: are all of the intuition of joy, etc.

original: nga nyid med ni yi ge ham gis tshul yang med pa yin te rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: nga nyid med ni yi ge ham gis tshul yang med pa yin te rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
translated: Without me, without the manner of the syllable ham, there is no concept of the nature of the vajra-holder.

original: mnyam nyid mtshungs par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: mnyam nyid mtshungs par 'dod pa yin //
translated: Equality is asserted as sameness.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad rnams mtshungs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad rnams mtshungs par bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: All of joy, etc., are to be made the same.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pas ni //
analyzed: ro mnyam de nyid bsgoms pas ni //
translated: By the cultivation of that sameness of taste,

original: mnyam pa zhes bya mtshungs par brjod //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes bya mtshungs par brjod //
translated: equality is said to be sameness.

original: ces dbyer med par bshad do //
analyzed: ces dbyer med par bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained as indivisible.

original: de yi 'khor lo ro zhes brjod //
analyzed: de yi 'khor lo ro zhes brjod //
translated: That wheel is said to be taste.

original: de'i nyams su myong ba'i ro'o //
analyzed: de'i nyams su myong ba'i ro'o //
translated: It is the experience of that.

original: ro gcig tu mnyam pa nyid 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ro gcig tu mnyam pa nyid 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes the sameness of one taste.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be expressed.

original: 'dis ni don gyis brjod par bya //
analyzed: 'dis ni don gyis brjod par bya //
translated: This is expressed by the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of that is stated:

original: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
translated: All migrating beings come from me.

original: nga las gnas gsum po yang byung //
analyzed: nga las gnas gsum po yang byung //
translated: The three abodes also come from me.

original: nga yis 'di kun khyab pa ste //🔽'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
analyzed: nga yis 'di kun khyab pa ste // 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gzhan ma mthong //
translated: I pervade all of this.🔽I do not see any other nature of migrating beings.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni tha dad du byas pa ci yang snang ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni tha dad du byas pa ci yang snang ba med do //
translated: The nature of others is not seen to be anything different.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad nga las byung ni dbang po dang yul gang dag rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba thams cad nga las byung ni dbang po dang yul gang dag rnam par shes pa las 'das pa'i phyir med do //
translated: Since all migrating beings come from me, the sense organs and objects do not exist because they are beyond consciousness.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni sku gsung thugs te gang rnam par shes pa las gzhan med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni sku gsung thugs te gang rnam par shes pa las gzhan med do //
translated: The three worlds are the body, speech, and mind that do not exist apart from consciousness.

original: nga yis 'di kun ni ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid nga rnam par shes pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: nga yis 'di kun ni ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid nga rnam par shes pas khyab pa'o //
translated: I pervade all of this with my consciousness, which is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses and the three kāyas.

original: de bas na de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan gyi rang bzhin 'gro ba ci yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan gyi rang bzhin 'gro ba ci yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, I do not see any other nature of migrating beings apart from the nature of consciousness.

original: 'gro ba kun ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa des na rnam par shes pa'i rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa des na rnam par shes pa'i rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since all beings are of the nature of a single pristine awareness, there is no such thing as a conceptual consciousness.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is stated:

original: rtogs bya rtogs pa'i rnam pa med //
analyzed: rtogs bya rtogs pa'i rnam pa med //
translated: The object of realization is without the aspect of realization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyis gzigs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyis gzigs //
translated: The mind of the Tathagata sees it.

original: gang la rtogs bya rtogs byed pa //
analyzed: gang la rtogs bya rtogs byed pa //
translated: Where there is an object of realization and a realizer,

original: de la byang chub yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang sems @101a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems @101a * //
translated: Moreover, the mind

original: kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: kyis sems mi mthong ngo //
translated: does not see the mind.

original: yang na / sems gnyis rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na / sems gnyis rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, two minds do not exist as conceptualizations.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas shes nas //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas shes nas //
translated: Thus, the yogi/ni, having understood this,

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gang goms pa //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gang goms pa //
translated: Should cultivate familiarity with the state of utter equipoise.

original: bsod nams chung ba'i mi yis kyang //
analyzed: bsod nams chung ba'i mi yis kyang //
translated: Even a person of little merit

original: de ni 'grub par the tshom med //
analyzed: de ni 'grub par the tshom med //
translated: Will undoubtedly accomplish this.

original: yi ge ae dang yi ge wam gyi bdag nyid kyi yid la byed pa'i ye shes kyis nges pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ae dang yi ge wam gyi bdag nyid kyi yid la byed pa'i ye shes kyis nges pa'o //
translated: This is the certainty of the wisdom of mental attention that is the nature of the vowels and consonants.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni zung 'jug la gnas nas goms pas mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni zung 'jug la gnas nas goms pas mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi/ni, abiding in union, will actualize it through familiarity.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni dbyer med par lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni dbyer med par lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: “Meditative equipoise” is the superior abiding in the indivisible.

original: de ni 'grub par ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: de ni 'grub par ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that one will accomplish the attainment of mahāmudrā.

original: bsod nams chung bas kyang ni zhes pa ni bsod nams bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyis re zhig 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams chung bas kyang ni zhes pa ni bsod nams bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyis re zhig 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: “Even those of little merit” means that those who have accumulated merit will certainly accomplish it.

original: bsod nams chung bas kyang ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid kyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams chung bas kyang ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid kyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: Even those of little merit will attain the attainment of the greatness of wisdom.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The connate [union] is taught to be the nature of engaging in uninterrupted activity.🔽It is said:🔽Eating, drinking, bathing,

original: gsungs pa / bza' dang btung dang 'khrud pa dang // nyal dang log dang sems pa na //
analyzed: gsungs pa / bza' dang btung dang 'khrud pa dang // nyal dang log dang sems pa na //
translated: sleeping, turning over, and thinking,

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pa //
translated: one who desires mahāmudrā

original: de nas mngon du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas mngon du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: will certainly proceed to it.

original: bza' dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la yang lhan cig skyes pa mngon du sems na rgyu de'i phyir phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa po lhan cig skyes par 'gro zhing lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin thob pa yin no //
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la yang lhan cig skyes pa mngon du sems na rgyu de'i phyir phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa po lhan cig skyes par 'gro zhing lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin thob pa yin no //
translated: Also, in the case of the activities of eating, drinking, and so on, if one is mindful of the innate, then for that reason, the one who desires the Great Seal goes to the innate, and attains the nature of the innate.

original: bza' bas lus kyi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bza' bas lus kyi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
translated: By eating, the clinging of the body is reversed.

original: btung bas ni ngag gi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: btung bas ni ngag gi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
translated: By drinking, the clinging of speech is reversed.

original: khrus ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: khrus ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa ldog pa'o //
translated: By bathing, the clinging of the mind is reversed.

original: nyal dang log pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bsams na ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyal dang log pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bsams na ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: By sleeping and lying down, if one contemplates the nature of Vajradhara inseparable from Nairātmya, with the nature of enthusiasm and gathering, one becomes of the nature of the single exalted wisdom.

original: de bas na de'i phyir mngon du yangs shing rgyas pa de'i dngos po mngon du lhan cig mthong bar 'gyur ba yin pas mngon sum du thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i phyir mngon du yangs shing rgyas pa de'i dngos po mngon du lhan cig mthong bar 'gyur ba yin pas mngon sum du thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, the extensive and vast innate is seen simultaneously with that entity, and is attained in actuality.

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pas ni phyag rgya chen po ni gang zhig mngon par kun la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon 'dod pas ni phyag rgya chen po ni gang zhig mngon par kun la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: One who desires the Great Seal is one who desires the Great Seal, which is pervaded by the pervasion of all.

original: 'dod pa ni brtag pa gang gi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni brtag pa gang gi'o //
translated: Desire is the investigation of what?

original: de ni phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa'i rdo rje 'dzin de bstan cing brjod pas so //
analyzed: de ni phyag rgya chen po mngon par 'dod pa'i rdo rje 'dzin de bstan cing brjod pas so //
translated: That is taught and expressed by the Vajra Holder who desires the Great Seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon @101b par 'dod pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon @101b par 'dod pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid bdag med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du rnal 'byor pas bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: Desiring the Great Seal means that the practitioner generates the nature of Nairātmya and Vajradhara, which is the nature of emanation and gathering.

original: mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid des na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid des na /
translated: By that characteristic of oneness in equality,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgom pa gsum ka mi dmigs par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang bsgom pa gsum ka mi dmigs par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: in order to teach the non-apprehension of the three - the meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation - it is said:

original: gang phyir yid kyis mi bsgom par //
analyzed: gang phyir yid kyis mi bsgom par //
translated: Because the mind does not meditate,

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
translated: all beings should be meditated upon.

original: thams cad chos ni yongs shes na //
analyzed: thams cad chos ni yongs shes na //
translated: When all phenomena are fully known,

original: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min //
translated: Meditation is not meditation.

original: 'gro ba thams cad khams gsum du gyur ba 'khor bar spyod pa'i 'gro ba ris drug tu son pa'i 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / ljon shing la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad nyid bsgom par bya ste snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad khams gsum du gyur ba 'khor bar spyod pa'i 'gro ba ris drug tu son pa'i 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / ljon shing la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad nyid bsgom par bya ste snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: All beings are the three realms, all worldly beings who have gone to the six life-journeys of cyclic existence, and all worldly environments such as trees, etc.

original: gang gis she na yid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis she na yid kyis so //
translated: By what? By the mind.

original: sems kyis sems tsam nyid du 'gro ba kun yin pa'i rgyu gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis sems tsam nyid du 'gro ba kun yin pa'i rgyu gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Because all beings are mind only.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called meditation.

original: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min ni snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa min ni snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Meditation is not meditation. It is explained as meditative equipoise.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad yongs su shes na gang de ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad yongs su shes na gang de ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Because when all phenomena are fully known, that is meditation.

original: chos thams cad dang lhan cig kun nas kun du gang gi phyir ye shes de'i phyir bsgom par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang lhan cig kun nas kun du gang gi phyir ye shes de'i phyir bsgom par mi bya'o //
translated: Because that wisdom is not at all in common with all phenomena, therefore it is not meditation.

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: It is not meditative equipoise.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon la ba'i na bza' can gyi zhal snga nas //
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon la ba'i na bza' can gyi zhal snga nas //
translated: Thus, the venerable master Bhavabhaṭṭa says:

original: gzugs brnyan lta bur gzung bar bya //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bur gzung bar bya //
translated: “One should apprehend it as a reflection.

original: thog ma med pa'i sems las byung //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i sems las byung //
translated: It arises from beginningless mind.

original: de yi rnam pa can zhes pa //
analyzed: de yi rnam pa can zhes pa //
translated: It is said to have the aspect of that.

original: phan tshun du ni gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: Like reflections in each other,

original: ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan shar la mig gi 'bras bu la yang me long shar ti dus gcig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan shar la mig gi 'bras bu la yang me long shar ti dus gcig pa nyid du'o //
translated: Just as a reflection arises in a mirror and the eye-ball arises in the mirror at the same time,

original: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu shar te dbang po dang yul dang shes pa rnams mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes te bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu shar te dbang po dang yul dang shes pa rnams mnyam pa nyid du gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes te bsgom pa nyid ni bsgom pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, the apprehended object and apprehending subject are always inseparable, arising as the wisdom of the equality of the characteristics of the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: 'gro ba'i sgras ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgras ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The word “world” refers to the sense faculties.

original: thams cad kyi skyes yul rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi skyes yul rnams so //
translated: The word “all” refers to the sense objects.

original: yid kyi sgras sems so //
analyzed: yid kyi sgras sems so //
translated: The word “mind” refers to the mind.

original: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid rtag tu ye shes yin no //
translated: Thus, the inseparability of the three vajras is always wisdom.

original: mdor bstan pa'i don rgyas par bshad pa //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i don rgyas par bshad pa //
translated: The meaning of the brief presentation is explained in detail.

original: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gang //
analyzed: brtan dang g-yo ba'i dngos po gang //
translated: Whatever things are stable or moving,

original: rtsva lcug 'khri shing la sogs pa //
analyzed: rtsva lcug 'khri shing la sogs pa //
translated: such as grass, twigs, vines, and so on,

original: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin las //🔽dam pa de @102a * //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin las // dam pa de @102a * //
translated: from the nature of one's own entity,

original: nyid nges bsgom bya //🔽'dir brtan pa ni mi rgyu ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyid nges bsgom bya // 'dir brtan pa ni mi rgyu ba rnams so //
translated: that sacred reality should be ascertained and cultivated.

original: g-yo ba ni rgyu ba rnams kyi srog chags so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rgyu ba rnams kyi srog chags so //
translated: Here, the stable refers to the unmoving, and the moving refers to the moving creatures.

original: de ltar brtan pa dang g-yo ba thams cad kyi dngos po'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar brtan pa dang g-yo ba thams cad kyi dngos po'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the entity of all stable and moving things is that.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa rtsva ni phra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa rtsva ni phra ba rnams so //
translated: In order to clarify that, grass is the subtle,

original: lcug ma ni bsdus pa'i tshul zor bu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lcug ma ni bsdus pa'i tshul zor bu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: twigs are the gathered form of a sickle,

original: 'khri shing ni yan lag gyes pa'i tshul yin pas rtsva lcug 'khri shing ngo //
analyzed: 'khri shing ni yan lag gyes pa'i tshul yin pas rtsva lcug 'khri shing ngo //
translated: and vines are the manner of branching limbs. Therefore, it is grass, twigs, and vines.

original: brtan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang 'grib pa 'phel ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa'i dngos po rnams kyang 'grib pa 'phel ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa gsum du yod pa yin no //
translated: The stable entities also have the nature of three types of increase and decrease.

original: rnam pa gsum nyid nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum nyid nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The very three types are being taught.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu ba rnams bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyu ba rnams bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates the moving ones, such as the beings.

original: de yang bsgom par bya ste dam pa'i de nyid ni mchog gi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bsgom par bya ste dam pa'i de nyid ni mchog gi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is to be cultivated. The highest reality is the nature of supreme intuition.

original: ji ltar zhe na gang gi phyir gyi don to /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang gi phyir gyi don to /
translated: How so? The meaning of “because” is as follows.

original: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of my own entity,

original: bdag gi dngos po ni bdag gi dngos po ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po ni bdag gi dngos po ste /
translated: my own entity is my own nature.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid gzod ma nas ma skyes pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i dngos po rnams gzod ma nas ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid gzod ma nas ma skyes pa de bzhin du brtan pa'i dngos po rnams gzod ma nas ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Just as I am primordially unborn, so too are all entities, both moving and unmoving, primordially unborn.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kun yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kun yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the reality of the correct intuition, because it is the realization of nonduality.

original: 'o na ci brtan pa dang g-yo ba dag dbyer med pa yin nam zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci brtan pa dang g-yo ba dag dbyer med pa yin nam zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well, then, are the moving and unmoving undifferentiated? It is said:

original: de rnams dam pa gcig yod min //🔽zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: de rnams dam pa gcig yod min // zhes pa smos te /
translated: There is no single highest reality of those.

original: de rnams ni brtan pa rnams kyi dam pa gcig yod min no //
analyzed: de rnams ni brtan pa rnams kyi dam pa gcig yod min no //
translated: Those moving and unmoving entities have no single highest reality.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rang rig pa bde ba chen po nyid //
analyzed: rang rig pa bde ba chen po nyid //
translated: Self-awareness is great bliss.

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes yin gyi /
translated: It is the nature of self-awareness, which is gnosis.

original: brtan pa rnams ni sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams ni sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stable ones are without mind.

original: yod na de rnams ni brtan pa rnams kyi dang g-yo ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yod na de rnams ni brtan pa rnams kyi dang g-yo ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: If it exists, it is of the stable ones and of the moving ones.

original: gang gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The one is nondual.

original: de dam pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dam pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The supreme of that is its nature.

original: dam pa de ci 'dra ba yin zhe na de gsungs pa /
analyzed: dam pa de ci 'dra ba yin zhe na de gsungs pa /
translated: What is that supreme like? That is stated:

original: yod min te /
analyzed: yod min te /
translated: It does not exist.

original: rang rig pa yod pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa yod pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the existence of self-awareness.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de ldog pa med pa yang med pa yin pas gnyi ga yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i mchog de nyid bde ba'i ye shes de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir de ldog pa med pa yang med pa yin pas gnyi ga yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i mchog de nyid bde ba'i ye shes de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Since the absence of that is also the absence of the opposite of the existence of self-awareness, both are the supreme nonduality, which is the nature of the absence of both. That is the gnosis of bliss, which is the true gnosis.

original: gang las rang rig pa gnyi ga las ldog pa yin pa gsungs pa /🔽rang rig las ni dngos grub yin //
analyzed: gang las rang rig pa gnyi ga las ldog pa yin pa gsungs pa / rang rig las ni dngos grub yin //
translated: From what is the self-awareness that is the opposite of both stated?🔽Siddhi is from self-awareness.

original: rang rig phyir ni bsgom pa nyid //
analyzed: rang rig phyir ni bsgom pa nyid //
translated: Cultivation is for the sake of self-awareness.

original: rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of one’s own awareness,

original: rtog pa las ni las skyes te //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: rtog pa las ni las skyes te // zhes pa la /
translated: Karma arises from conceptualization.

original: gang rang rig pa'i rgyu las /
analyzed: gang rang rig pa'i rgyu las /
translated: As for “from the nature of one’s own awareness,”

original: phyag rgya chen po'i @102b dngos grub thob pa yin pas na /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i @102b dngos grub thob pa yin pas na /
translated: one attains the spiritual power of mahāmudrā.

original: rang rig las ni dngos grub yin //
analyzed: rang rig las ni dngos grub yin //
translated: Therefore, “spiritual power is from one’s own awareness.”

original: rang rig pa la bsgom pa nyid //
analyzed: rang rig pa la bsgom pa nyid //
translated: “Meditation is on one’s own awareness”

original: ces pa ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ces pa ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: means that it is because of that.

original: rang rig pa'i ye shes de'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ye shes de'o //
translated: “One’s own awareness” is that wisdom.

original: bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Meditation” is meditative equipoise.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because both are inseparable by nature,🔽whatever karma is of the nature of one’s own awareness, that karma also has the nature of the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi las gang de'i las kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid la de yang rang rig pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi las gang de'i las kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid la de yang rang rig pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yin no //
translated: That is also the magical display of one’s own awareness.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang / rtog pa las ni las skyes te //
analyzed: gang / rtog pa las ni las skyes te //
translated: “Karma arises from conceptualization.”

original: zhes pa'o // rtog pa zhes pa ni 'khrul ba ste de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rtog pa zhes pa ni 'khrul ba ste de las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Conceptualization” is delusion, and karma arises from that.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis ni thams cad 'dus byas pa ste ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis ni thams cad 'dus byas pa ste ;
translated: Conditioned by ignorance, everything is compounded.

original: / ma rig pa yang gti mug go //
analyzed: / ma rig pa yang gti mug go //
translated: And ignorance is delusion.

original: gti mug kyang 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug kyang 'khrul pa'o //
translated: And delusion is error.

original: de la yang der zhen pa 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang der zhen pa 'khrul pa'o //
translated: And clinging to that is error.

original: de ltar thag pa bsgril ba la sprul du shes pa de'i yang 'khrul pa nyid sa bon no //
analyzed: de ltar thag pa bsgril ba la sprul du shes pa de'i yang 'khrul pa nyid sa bon no //
translated: Thus, the seed of the error of the rope-snake is the error of the rope.

original: de'i phyir / 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rtog pa skye //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rtog pa skye //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization arises by the power of error.

original: de nas yang las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byung ste 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas yang las bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byung ste 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Then, again, action arises from pleasure and pain, etc. In order to teach just this, he says:

original: rang gis 'phrog po rang nyid byed /
analyzed: rang gis 'phrog po rang nyid byed /
translated: The self is the thief, the self is the creator,

original: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rang nyid rgyal po rang gtso bo'o //
translated: the self is the king, the self is the chief.

original: rang gis 'phrog ni rang rig bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gis 'phrog ni rang rig bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The self is the thief, because of the nature of the collection of the self-knowing.

original: rang nyid byed po ni rang nyid spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang nyid byed po ni rang nyid spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The self is the creator, because of the nature of the self-projection.

original: rang nyid rgyal po ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: rang nyid rgyal po ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin no ;
translated: The self is the king, because of the nature of the self-illumination.

original: / rang nyid gtso bo zhes pa ni thams cad kyi bdag po dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rang nyid gtso bo zhes pa ni thams cad kyi bdag po dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The self is the chief, because of the possession of the lordship of all.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar rab tu gsal ba spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar rab tu gsal ba spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Like a gem with various forms, it is the nature of emanation and re-absorption.

original: 'phrog cing gi tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phrog cing gi tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: In the manner of a thief, it is the nature of objects such as form.

original: byed po'i tshul gyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byed po'i tshul gyis mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In the manner of an agent, it is the nature of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: rgyal po'i tshul gyis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i tshul gyis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In the manner of a king, it is the nature of consciousness.

original: gtso bo'i tshul gyis shes pa dang dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i tshul gyis shes pa dang dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: In the manner of a chief, the inseparability of cognition, sense faculties, and objects is authentic wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes rang nyid byed po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ye shes rang nyid byed po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, since wisdom itself is the agent,🔽attachment, aversion, jealousy,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang phrag dog dang // de bzhin gti mug nga rgyal nyid //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang phrag dog dang // de bzhin gti mug nga rgyal nyid //
translated: and likewise ignorance and pride,

original: de kun de'i gnas nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: de kun de'i gnas nyams dga' bar //
translated: all of those are the delightful abode of that.

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
translated: Even a sixteenth part is not comparable.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de thams cad do //
translated: All of those are attachment, aversion, and so on.

original: de'i gnas ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'o //
translated: The abode of that is the realization of authentic wisdom.

original: cis khyad par 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par 'phags she na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: nyams dga' ba ste /
analyzed: nyams dga' ba ste /
translated: It is delightful.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni nyams dga' @103a * //🔽bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni nyams dga' @103a * // bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Attachment and so forth are delightful.🔽They arise by the nature of the five intuitions, by the nature of that.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis 'byung ste ye shes nyid kyis ma ning du bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis 'byung ste ye shes nyid kyis ma ning du bstan to //
translated: The neutral is taught by intuition itself.

original: thams cad kyi bcu drug char yang mi phod na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bcu drug char yang mi phod na /
translated: If it is not even a sixteenth part of all,

original: bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid kyi zla ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid kyi zla ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: it is the moon itself, the nature of fifteen parts.

original: bcu drug pa'i cha de ni med pa nyid de bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bcu drug pa'i cha de ni med pa nyid de bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: That sixteenth part does not exist, because it has no function at all.

original: / de mi phod pa ni mchod pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de mi phod pa ni mchod pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not being able to bear that, it does not make offerings.

original: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kun nyid do //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kun nyid do //
translated: The nature of all is the nature of self-awareness.

original: bcu drug ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa'o //🔽cha ni / ka bde ba de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na cha bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: bcu drug ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa'o // cha ni / ka bde ba de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na cha bdag med ma'o //
translated: Sixteen is the purity of the sixteen emptinesses.🔽Part is the part of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de mi phod pa ni mi mchod pa ste thams cad snang ba med par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi phod pa ni mi mchod pa ste thams cad snang ba med par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not being able to bear that, it does not make offerings, because everything becomes invisible.

original: bla ma'i dus tshigs bsten pas lhan cig skyes pa'i shes pa yin par de gsungs pa //
analyzed: bla ma'i dus tshigs bsten pas lhan cig skyes pa'i shes pa yin par de gsungs pa //
translated: The guru’s time is the innate consciousness.

original: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni //
analyzed: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes ni //
translated: The gnosis born from the source of phenomena

original: mkha' mnyam lhan cig thabs dang bcas //
analyzed: mkha' mnyam lhan cig thabs dang bcas //
translated: is equal to space, together with the method.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of method and wisdom,

original: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po de las skyes //
translated: the three worlds are born from that.

original: chos rnams kyi 'byung ba gang la yod pa de ni chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'byung ba gang la yod pa de ni chos 'byung ngo //
translated: The source of phenomena is that which is the source of phenomena.

original: de las byung ni skyes pa ste ye shes gang la yod pa'i ye shes de ni chos 'byung las skyes so //
analyzed: de las byung ni skyes pa ste ye shes gang la yod pa'i ye shes de ni chos 'byung las skyes so //
translated: That which is born from that is the gnosis born from the source of phenomena.

original: cis khyad par 'phags she na mkha' mnyam ste /
analyzed: cis khyad par 'phags she na mkha' mnyam ste /
translated: How is it distinguished? It is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: It is like space.

original: slar yang cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽thabs dang bcas pa'o /
analyzed: slar yang cir 'gyur zhe na / thabs dang bcas pa'o /
translated: Again, what happens?🔽It is together with the method.

original: thabs dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thabs dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
translated: It is together with the method.

original: thabs dang bcas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma'o //
translated: The method is Vajradhara and Nairātmya.

original: de lhan cig ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de lhan cig ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Together with that is the possession of that.

original: de las de'i phyir 'gro ba gsum po skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las de'i phyir 'gro ba gsum po skyes pa'o //
translated: From that, the three worlds are born.

original: 'di ni gang gi phyir te thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid de'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi phyir te thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid de'i ye shes so //
translated: This is because it is the gnosis of that very nature of method and wisdom.

original: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Or else, the source of phenomena is Nairātmya.

original: las skyes ni rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: las skyes ni rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Born from action is Vajradhara.

original: chos 'byung yang yin la las skyes kyang yin pas chos 'byung las skyes so //
analyzed: chos 'byung yang yin la las skyes kyang yin pas chos 'byung las skyes so //
translated: Since it is both the source of phenomena and born from action, it is born from the source of phenomena.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes mkha' mnyam ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes mkha' mnyam ste /
translated: Such gnosis is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' lta bur ro mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur ro mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is of the same taste as space.

original: lhan cig thabs dang bcas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig thabs dang bcas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Together with the method is the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya.

original: de la ni de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni de las skyes pa'o //
translated: In that, it is born from that.

original: gsum yang yin la 'jig rten yang yin pas 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum yang yin la 'jig rten yang yin pas 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: Since it is three and also a world, it is the three worlds.

original: de rnams kyi dngos po ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dngos po ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The entity of those is the three worlds.

original: gsum gyi sgra ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: gsum gyi sgra ni sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The word three is body, speech, and mind.

original: 'jig rten gyi sgra ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sgra ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: The word world is the five aggregates.

original: de ba skyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i tshul gyis de'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid la rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de ba skyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i tshul gyis de'i bdag nyid kyis de nyid la rnam par gnas so //
translated: It is the nature of that, by the method of generating the generated and the generator, it abides in that.

original: 'dis ni sku @103b gsum dang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kho na ye shes de yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sku @103b gsum dang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kho na ye shes de yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the three bodies and the five intuitions, that intuition itself.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin las /
translated: From the nature of means and insight.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi sgras ni a'a li k'a li'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi sgras ni a'a li k'a li'o //
translated: The terms means and insight are ālikāli.

original: sv'a'i sgra ni thugs aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: sv'a'i sgra ni thugs aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: The term svā is the mind, the avadhūti.

original: 'di rnams kyi dngos po las te 'di'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dngos po las te 'di'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the entity of these, because this is their nature.

original: 'dis ni gnyis su med pa nyid gnyis so ;
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis su med pa nyid gnyis so ;
translated: This is the nonduality.

original: / de dang dbyer med par 'di gsum de dang tha mi dad pa'i lnga yin no //
analyzed: / de dang dbyer med par 'di gsum de dang tha mi dad pa'i lnga yin no //
translated: Inseparable from that, these three are the five, not different from that.

original: 'di ni bzhi'i bdag nyid bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi'i bdag nyid bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the nature of the four, the fourth, the intuition of the nature of the connate.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid lhan cig skyes par rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid lhan cig skyes par rab tu gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The illumination of the nature of means and insight as connate is:

original: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Bhagavān is the form of semen.

original: de yi bde ba 'dod mar brjod //
analyzed: de yi bde ba 'dod mar brjod //
translated: The bliss of that is said to be the “desire of the female.”

original: gcig dang du ma bral ba ste //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma bral ba ste //
translated: Free from one and many,

original: skad gcig gcig las gzhan dga' ba kun du bya ba kun nas bya ba gsal byed pas na /
analyzed: skad gcig gcig las gzhan dga' ba kun du bya ba kun nas bya ba gsal byed pas na /
translated: the single moment of the supreme joy of the great passion is the all-accomplishing, all-illuminating,

original: rnam pa khu ba nyid kyi rnam pas khu ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa khu ba nyid kyi rnam pas khu ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: the aspect of the semen.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das chos 'byung las skyes pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin no ;
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das chos 'byung las skyes pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin no ;
translated: That is the Vajra Holder, born from the bhaga of the Bhagavān, the nature of the relative truth.

original: / de'i bde ba ni de la yod pa'i ye shes gang de'o //
analyzed: / de'i bde ba ni de la yod pa'i ye shes gang de'o //
translated: The bliss of that is the gnosis that exists in that, and that is the “desire of the female.”

original: 'dod mar ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dod mar ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The female is Nairātmya, the nature of the ultimate truth.

original: brjod ni ye shes te 'di ni khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: brjod ni ye shes te 'di ni khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The “expression” is gnosis, and that is the Bhagavān in the aspect of semen.

original: gcig dang du ma'i sbyor bral ni //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i sbyor bral ni //
translated: Free from one and many,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'di la sbyor ba yin pas sbyor bral lo //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis 'di la sbyor ba yin pas sbyor bral lo //
translated: it is free from union, since it is united with the various modes.

original: gcig nyid du ma yin pas gcig dang du ma ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid du ma yin pas gcig dang du ma ste /
translated: It is neither one nor many, and so it is free from one and many.

original: gcig dang du ma'i sbyor ba dang bral bas gcig dang du ma'i sbyor bral lo //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i sbyor ba dang bral bas gcig dang du ma'i sbyor bral lo //
translated: It is free from the combination of one and many, because it is free from the combination of one and many.

original: 'dis ni gnyis su med pa dang gnyis la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sgro ba dang bsdu ba dbyer med pa tha mi dad pa gcig pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis su med pa dang gnyis la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sgro ba dang bsdu ba dbyer med pa tha mi dad pa gcig pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the way of non-duality, non-combination, non-division, and non-difference.

original: 'di ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: skad cig las ni lhan cig skyes pas so //
analyzed: skad cig las ni lhan cig skyes pas so //
translated: It is co-emergent from moment-to-moment.

original: gcig ni dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni dbyer med pa'o //
translated: One is indivisible.

original: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: Supreme is exalted.

original: dga' ni phul du byung ba med pa'i bde ba gcig gi mtshan nyid chags pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ni phul du byung ba med pa'i bde ba gcig gi mtshan nyid chags pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Bliss is the characteristic of the sole bliss that is free from the highest, which is the nature of liberation from all attachments, the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag nyid shes bya bsod nams las //
analyzed: bdag nyid shes bya bsod nams las //
translated: It is said to be from the knowledge of self and merit.

original: zhes pa gang de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi rig pa'i ye shes 'di nyams su myong bas na rig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gang de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi rig pa'i ye shes 'di nyams su myong bas na rig pa'o //
translated: This clarifies that very thing. Since this self-awareness wisdom is experienced, it is awareness.

original: yang dag ni yang dag par chags pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa de ltar yang dag par rig pa'o //🔽de yang ye shes bdag @104a * //
analyzed: yang dag ni yang dag par chags pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa de ltar yang dag par rig pa'o // de yang ye shes bdag @104a * //
translated: The correct is the correct knowledge of that non-conceptuality by virtue of being free from all attachments.

original: med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa dbyer med pa'i rang gi rig pa'o //
analyzed: med ma dang rdo rje 'dzin pa dbyer med pa'i rang gi rig pa'o //
translated: And that is one's own awareness of the indivisibility of Jnanadakini and Vajradhara.

original: ngag gi lam 'das spyod yul te //
analyzed: ngag gi lam 'das spyod yul te //
translated: It is beyond the path of speech, the domain.

original: zhes pa ni 'di ltar gzhan gyis brjod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di ltar gzhan gyis brjod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is like this: it cannot be expressed by another.

original: 'di ni byin brlab rim pa'i phyir ni rim par rnyed pas na rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byin brlab rim pa'i phyir ni rim par rnyed pas na rim pa'o //
translated: It is the stage of consecration, because it is attained in stages.

original: 'di zhes pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽byin ni lhag par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin no // byin ni lhag par dmigs pa'o //
translated: The this is the nature of one's own awareness.🔽Consecration is the special observation.

original: brlab ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brlab ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Blessing is the abiding.

original: brtan zhing mi g-yo ba nyid gang rim par rnyed pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: brtan zhing mi g-yo ba nyid gang rim par rnyed pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stability and immobility that is attained in stages is the stage of consecration,

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of immobility, the pervasive essence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang las kyang mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang las kyang mi rnyed de /
translated: For that very reason, it is not attained from anywhere.

original: gang 'di lta bu'i ye shes kun du snang bar brjod pa rang rig pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i ye shes kun du snang bar brjod pa rang rig pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: This kind of gnosis is not the domain of reflexive awareness, which is said to be an appearance.

original: de ci yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: What is it?

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “because.”

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
translated: that gnosis is the nature of the Omniscient One.

original: thams cad shes pas na thams cad mkhyen pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: thams cad shes pas na thams cad mkhyen pa ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Omniscient One is the Buddha Bhagavān, because he knows everything.

original: de'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni /
translated: His gnosis

original: bag la nyal gyi bag chags kyi shes pa yan chad nye bar zhi ba'i gang ye shes so //
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi bag chags kyi shes pa yan chad nye bar zhi ba'i gang ye shes so //
translated: is the gnosis that is the pacification of the consciousness of latent tendencies and so on.

original: de rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rang bzhin no //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo de kun mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo de kun mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that its essence is that gnosis of the Omniscient One.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sa dang chu dang de bzhin rlung //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid dbang po dang yul dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir / sa dang chu dang de bzhin rlung //
translated: In order to teach that the nature of the great arising of that kind of nonconceptual gnosis is the indivisibility of the sense faculties and objects, it is said:🔽Earth, water, and likewise wind,

original: me dang nam mkha' nyid dag ni //
analyzed: me dang nam mkha' nyid dag ni //
translated: fire, and space itself,

original: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba yi //
analyzed: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba yi //
translated: The feeling of self and other awareness

original: kun gyis skad cig mi gnod de //
analyzed: kun gyis skad cig mi gnod de //
translated: is not harmed by the moment.

original: sa la sogs pa 'di thams cad la mi gnod de //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'di thams cad la mi gnod de //
translated: This entire earth and so forth is not harmed.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba ni //
analyzed: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba ni //
translated: The feeling of self and other awareness

original: rang gzhan rig pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gzhan rig pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: is the complete understanding of self and other awareness.

original: skad cig gis ni skad cig gi ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni skad cig gi ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: By the moment, the co-emergent of the moment of wisdom is the correct awareness.

original: yang na / sa la sogs pa 'di kun la //
analyzed: yang na / sa la sogs pa 'di kun la //
translated: Or, this entire earth and so forth

original: skad cig gis ni mi gnod de //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni mi gnod de //
translated: is not harmed by the moment.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gis lhan cig 'di rnams kyi gnod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gis lhan cig 'di rnams kyi gnod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: By the moment of co-emergence, these co-emergent ones are without the conceptualization of harm.

original: skad cig dbyer med pa nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: skad cig dbyer med pa nyid 'di yin no //
translated: This is the indivisibility of the moment.

original: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba ni //
analyzed: rang gzhan rig pa'i tshor ba ni //
translated: The feeling of self and other awareness

original: skad cig gis mi gnod ces pa la rang ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: skad cig gis mi gnod ces pa la rang ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: is not harmed by the moment. Self is the senses.

original: gzhan yul rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan yul rnams so //
translated: Other is the objects.

original: rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Awareness is consciousness.

original: de ltar na rang gzhan rig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gzhan rig pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is self and other awareness.

original: 'di rnams kyi rig pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rig pa ni ye shes so //
translated: The awareness of these is wisdom.

original: skad cig gis mi gnod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa dang lhan cig @104b pas dang nga po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gis mi gnod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa dang lhan cig @104b pas dang nga po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnod pa yin no //
translated: The non-harmfulness in an instant is the harmfulness of the innate, the simultaneous, the first, the object, and the consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum dang dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum dang dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the innate is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: mtho ris mi yul sa 'og gis //
analyzed: mtho ris mi yul sa 'og gis //
translated: By the heavens, the human realm, and the underworld,

original: skad cig gis ni sku gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni sku gcig 'gyur //
translated: in an instant, there is one body.

original: rnal 'byor pa de sku gcig tu gyur te dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba'o ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de sku gcig tu gyur te dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba'o ;
translated: That yogin is born as one body, with the nature of inseparability.

original: / mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og gis te /
analyzed: / mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og gis te /
translated: By the heavens, the human realm, and the underworld,

original: ye shes kyi skad cig gis so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi skad cig gis so //
translated: in an instant of gnosis.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the innate nature is stated.

original: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i gnyis su med pa nyid de ye shes kyang yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i gnyis su med pa nyid de ye shes kyang yin par gsungs pa /
translated: The nonduality of the inseparability of method and wisdom is also stated to be gnosis.

original: rang gzhan cha yi rnam rtog gis //
analyzed: rang gzhan cha yi rnam rtog gis //
translated: By the concepts of self and other,

original: gnod pa nyid ni nus pa min //
analyzed: gnod pa nyid ni nus pa min //
translated: harmfulness is not possible.

original: rang gzhan gyi sgras skyes pa dang bud med de dag gis so //
analyzed: rang gzhan gyi sgras skyes pa dang bud med de dag gis so //
translated: By the terms self and other, there are men and women.

original: cha ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: cha ni dbye ba'o //
translated: Part means division.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa des gnod pa nyid min te rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa des gnod pa nyid min te rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Such a conceptualization is not harmful, it is conceptualization.

original: nus pa min ni /
analyzed: nus pa min ni /
translated: Not capable means

original: rtog pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir ye shes kyi'o //
translated: of the wisdom that transcends all thought and conceptualization.

original: ye shes 'di nyid kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: ye shes 'di nyid kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa /
translated: The greatness of this very wisdom is taught:🔽By all the Vedas, philosophy,

original: thams cad rig byed grub mtha' dang // de bzhin las rgyas la sogs pas //
analyzed: thams cad rig byed grub mtha' dang // de bzhin las rgyas la sogs pas //
translated: and likewise by the extensive rites,

original: dag pa'i dngos grub 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: dag pa'i dngos grub 'byung ma yin //
translated: Pure siddhis do not arise.

original: srid pa'i skye ba gzhan du'ang /
analyzed: srid pa'i skye ba gzhan du'ang /
translated: Even in other births in existence,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thams cad 'di nyid kyis mi 'thob ste //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thams cad 'di nyid kyis mi 'thob ste //
translated: All the siddhis of mahamudra are not attained by this.

original: rig byed yang yin la grub mtha' yang yin pas rig byed grub mtha'o //
analyzed: rig byed yang yin la grub mtha' yang yin pas rig byed grub mtha'o //
translated: Because it is both a Veda and a philosophy, it is a Veda and philosophy.

original: thams cad kyang yin la rig byed grub mtha' yang yin pas thams cad rig byed grub mtha'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la rig byed grub mtha' yang yin pas thams cad rig byed grub mtha'o //
translated: Because it is all and it is a Veda and philosophy, it is all Vedas and philosophies.

original: de ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'i ngag snyan cing 'jebs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug chen po dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'i ngag snyan cing 'jebs pa'o //
translated: That is the sweet and charming speech of Vishnu, Mahesvara, Vasudhara, and so on.

original: rang gi lhag pa'i 'jebs pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi lhag pa'i 'jebs pa ni /
translated: One's own is superior.

original: las rab 'byams la sogs pas kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'byung ba ma yin te mi 'thob po //
analyzed: las rab 'byams la sogs pas kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'byung ba ma yin te mi 'thob po //
translated: The great seal is not produced by the various actions, and so on, nor is it attained.🔽How is it again?

original: slar ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /🔽dag pas te /
analyzed: slar ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa / dag pas te /
translated: It is said:🔽by purity.

original: rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: By complete purity.

original: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dbyer med par rtogs pa las kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dbyer med par rtogs pa las kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi phyir ro //
translated: From the realization of the indivisibility of the creation and perfection stages, there is the wisdom of the conventional and ultimate paths.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: srid pa'i skye ba gzhan du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i skye ba gzhan du'o //
translated: In other births in existence.

original: skye ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
translated: Birth is this world.

original: srid pa gzhan ni skye ba phyi ma ste yang skye ba la'o //
analyzed: srid pa gzhan ni skye ba phyi ma ste yang skye ba la'o //
translated: Another existence is a future birth, that is, another birth.

original: 'dis ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams su yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'thob po //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams su yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'thob po //
translated: By this, the great seal is not attained in other and other births.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa /
translated: That is clarified:

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol du //
translated: In this world and the next,

original: de med pas kyang dngos grub med //
analyzed: de med pas kyang dngos grub med //
translated: there is no success without it.

original: @105a * // rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa de med par 'jig rten gnyi ga ru yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: @105a * // rnam par dag pa yongs su shes pa de med par 'jig rten gnyi ga ru yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Without that knowledge of the pure, there is no success of the Great Seal in either of the two worlds.

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba bstan par byas pa yin no //
translated: The pervasion is established by the counter-pervasion.

original: gang gis mi shes kyi rdo rje //
analyzed: gang gis mi shes kyi rdo rje //
translated: The one who does not know the vajra

original: de yi ngal ba don med 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ngal ba don med 'gyur //
translated: their effort is pointless.

original: gang gis ni rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: gang gis ni rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The one who is a yogi.

original: kye rdo rje ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kye rdo rje ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The vajra is the wisdom of the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate, emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations.

original: mi shes pa ni ma rtogs so //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni ma rtogs so //
translated: Not knowing is not realizing.

original: de'i ngal ba ni /
analyzed: de'i ngal ba ni /
translated: Their effort

original: rig byed la sogs pa'i ngag 'jebs pa'i don gyis bsgyur pa'i nyon mongs pas yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ni mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa'i ngag 'jebs pa'i don gyis bsgyur pa'i nyon mongs pas yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ni mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is pointless because they do not attain the result that is the characteristic of true awakening due to the affliction of the meaning of the transformation of the Vedas and so on.

original: don med pa ni byed pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa ni byed pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaningless is devoid of effect, because it is devoid of activity.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje yang shes nas rtag tu goms pa med par dngos grub med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje yang shes nas rtag tu goms pa med par dngos grub med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no success without the constant practice of the knowledge of Hevajra,
