original: chu bo'i rgyun ni rab 'thab dang // mar me'i 'od kyi rgyun bzhin du //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun ni rab 'thab dang // mar me'i 'od kyi rgyun bzhin du //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, like the current of a river, like the flame of a lamp,

original: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: rtag tu de nyid rnal 'byor pas //
translated: the yogi/nī should always🔽establish it day and night.

original: nyin dang mtshan du rnam par gzhag / ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun 'bab pa la khyad par med pa dang / mar me'i 'od la yang rgyun gyi bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du rnam par gzhag / ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun 'bab pa la khyad par med pa dang / mar me'i 'od la yang rgyun gyi bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as there is no difference in the current of a river, and there is no distinction of a continuum in the flame of a lamp,

original: de bzhin du khams gsum dbyer med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sku gcig par rnal 'byor pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum dbyer med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sku gcig par rnal 'byor pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, the yogi/nī should establish the single body of nonconceptual gnosis, which is the indivisibility of the three realms, endowed with the yoga of Hevajra.

original: nyin dang mtshan du zhes pa ni dus thams cad du bar chad med par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du zhes pa ni dus thams cad du bar chad med par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Day and night means at all times without interruption.

original: de lta'i rim par phye ba rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rim par phye ba gsungs pa'i don bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta'i rim par phye ba rdzogs pa'i sgo nas rim par phye ba gsungs pa'i don bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus completed the explanation of the divisions, he summarizes the meaning of the explanation of the divisions:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
translated: In the Hevajra, the body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent ones,

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba'i rim par phye ba ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba'i rim par phye ba ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: the so-called Yoginī Wheel is the eighth chapter of the great assembly of Yoginīs.

original: ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i yi shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i yi shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The gnosis of the inseparability of the relative and the ultimate, which is the nature of the five gnoses, the three bodies, and method and prajñā, is the Yoginī of the Hevajra, the body, speech, and mind of all the transcendent ones.

original: gang 'khor lo ni mi shes pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'khor lo ni mi shes pa gcod pa'o //
translated: The wheel is that which cuts through non-knowledge.

original: de la rim par phye ba de ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rim par phye ba de ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: The division of that is called the Yoginī Wheel.

original: rnal 'byor ma chen mo ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma chen mo ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: The great Yoginī is Nairātmya.

original: de'i 'du ba ni 'du ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'du ba ni 'du ba ste /
translated: Her assembly is the assembly.

original: des sel bar khyab pa'o //
analyzed: des sel bar khyab pa'o //
translated: That is the pervading.

original: @105b de nas gang bde ba'i ye shes gang la rim par phye ba de ni /
analyzed: @105b de nas gang bde ba'i ye shes gang la rim par phye ba de ni /
translated: Then, the wisdom that is blissful, which is divided into stages, is

original: rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma chen mo 'du ba can no //
translated: the assembly of the great yoginīs.

original: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, cloth is a covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba'o //
translated: Since it takes and holds that, it is a division.

original: de yang brgyad na khyab pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de yang brgyad na khyab pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Moreover, it is the mode of pervasion in eight.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the name “vajra-holder who is pure by means of the sixteen emptinesses” is explained.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel ba las le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel ba las le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter in the commentary on the tantra of the glorious Bhagavān Hevajra, called “Illuminating Lamp,” composed by the great master Lakṣmī.

original: // / da ni rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa de yang dag pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bskyed pa yin pas phung po la sogs pa rnam pa gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni rim pa gnyis rnam par dag pa de yang dag pa'i ye shes phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bskyed pa yin pas phung po la sogs pa rnam pa gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, since that pure twofold stage generates the great seal of authentic wisdom, in order to teach the purity of both aspects of the aggregates and so on, it is said:

original: de nas gzhan rnam par dag pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan rnam par dag pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: Now, the other chapter on purity will be explained.

original: de nas ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo las so //
analyzed: de nas ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo las so //
translated: Now, from the wheel of yoginis.

original: gzhan ni rjes thogs so //
analyzed: gzhan ni rjes thogs so //
translated: Other, subsequent.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rim par phye ba ni khyad par du 'phags par dag pas na rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rim par phye ba ni khyad par du 'phags par dag pas na rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The division of purity is especially pure, therefore pure.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag mid ma gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag mid ma gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate is the non-duality of Vajradhara and Nairatmya.

original: rim par phye ba ni gos 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: rim par phye ba ni gos 'gebs pa'o //
translated: The division is the covering of the cloth.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba'o //
translated: Since it takes and holds that, it is the division.

original: bshad par bya'o ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshul gyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i tshul gyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: Will be explained, it will be taught by the method of superiority.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: nges par dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: nges par dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: The purity of all things

original: dag pa de bzhin nyid du brjod //
analyzed: dag pa de bzhin nyid du brjod //
translated: is said to be suchness.

original: ces pa la don 'di la gnas pas na dngos po'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa la don 'di la gnas pas na dngos po'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of things is the meaning of reality.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni khyad par du 'phags par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni khyad par du 'phags par dag pa'o //
translated: Their purity is especially pure.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin nyid de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That suchness is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: thams cad kyi zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes pa ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: “All” refers to the animate and inanimate.

original: gnyi ga yang gang dngos po nyid kyis yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gang dngos po nyid kyis yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: Both are imagined by way of their own nature.

original: don de rtogs pa stong pa nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: don de rtogs pa stong pa nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The realization of that object is the result of the valid knowledge of emptiness.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate purity.

original: phyi nas re re dbye ba yis //
analyzed: phyi nas re re dbye ba yis //
translated: After that, the divisions of each

original: lha rnams kyi yang brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi yang brjod par bya //
translated: will be stated for the gods.

original: phyi nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs su ma chad par ro //
analyzed: phyi nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs su ma chad par ro //
translated: “After that” means immediately after, without interruption.

original: re re dbye ba yis ni re re'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: re re dbye ba yis ni re re'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “The divisions of each” means the aspects of each.

original: gang rnams kyi zhe na lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi zhe na lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Whose?” The gods’.

original: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of distinction.

original: de nyid phyir brjod par bya ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir brjod par bya ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Will be stated” means will be made clear.

original: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob kyi @106a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob kyi @106a * //
translated: Because of the nature of signs, the conventional

original: bden pa'i lha rnams kyi re re'i dbye bas phung po lnga dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ste /🔽kun rdzob kyi bden par lha'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i lha rnams kyi re re'i dbye bas phung po lnga dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ste / kun rdzob kyi bden par lha'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag par bya'o //
translated: The purity of the aggregates and so on by the aspect of the deity is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yin pas rim pa gnyi ga dbyer med pa bsgom pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yin pas rim pa gnyi ga dbyer med pa bsgom pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the ultimate truth is also the aspect of suchness, when one meditates on the inseparability of the two stages, that is the teaching of perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: da ni nges par dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pas spyir bshad pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan nas /🔽phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: da ni nges par dngos po thams cad kyi zhes pas spyir bshad pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa'i rnam par dag pa bstan nas / phyi nas re re'i dbye ba yis //
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of the general explanation of the purity of the ultimate truth with “now, definitely all entities,”

original: lha rnams kyi yang brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi yang brjod par bya //
translated: the purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”

original: zhes pas dngos po'i dbye ba nyid khyad par du bstan pa /🔽phung po lnga dang dbang po drug / skye mched drug dang 'byung chen lnga //
analyzed: zhes pas dngos po'i dbye ba nyid khyad par du bstan pa /🔽phung po lnga dang dbang po drug / skye mched drug dang 'byung chen lnga //
translated: The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”🔽The purity of the ultimate truth is explained with “by the divisions of each of the deities.”

original: rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par dag / dbang po drug ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni rnam par dag / dbang po drug ni /
translated: Naturally pure.🔽The six sense faculties are

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi cha rnams ni dbang po drug go //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi cha rnams ni dbang po drug go //
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: phung po lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: skye mched drug ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six sense bases are form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: 'byung chen lnga ni /
analyzed: 'byung chen lnga ni /
translated: The five great elements are

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: 'di thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhes pa gzod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhes pa gzod ma nyid nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: All of these are naturally pure, because they are primordially the essence of non-arising, and therefore they are pure and naturally luminous.

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the pure ultimate truth.

original: de nyid nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs shes bya'i sgrib pa ni /
translated: That itself is the obscuration of affliction and the obscuration of cognition.

original: de lha'i rnam pas sbyang ni /
analyzed: de lha'i rnam pas sbyang ni /
translated: The purification of that by the deity is

original: de gang kun rdzob kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de gang kun rdzob kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: What is that? The purity of the relative.

original: gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa yang rang rig pa'i bdag nyid nyid de'i rnam par dag pa med na grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa yang rang rig pa'i bdag nyid nyid de'i rnam par dag pa med na grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The purity of both is the nature of reflexive awareness. If that purity were absent, there would be no liberation.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: rang rig bdag nyid dag pa nyid //
analyzed: rang rig bdag nyid dag pa nyid //
translated: Purity is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //
analyzed: dag pa gzhan gyis rnam grol min //
translated: Liberation is not by any other purity.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? That is stated:

original: yul gyi dngos po dag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul gyi dngos po dag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the entity of the object is pure,🔽there is the supreme bliss of reflexive awareness.

original: rang gi rig pa'i bde ba mchog / yul gyi zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa rnam dag go //🔽dngos po dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i bde ba mchog / yul gyi zhes pa ni yul la sogs pa rnam dag go // dngos po dag pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: “ Object” refers to the purity of the object and so on.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag gi rang bzhin lha'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag gi rang bzhin lha'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: “ Because the entity is pure” refers to the purity of the deity’s form, which is the nature of the ultimate and the relative.

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa gang ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa gang ngo //
translated: “ Because it is the nature” refers to reflexive awareness.

original: bde ba mchog ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba mchog ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: “ Supreme bliss” is the authentic pristine consciousness.

original: gang gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs na de nyid mngon du @106b gyur pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs na de nyid mngon du @106b gyur pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if both are realized to be inseparable, that is the actualization of reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams gang //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams gang //
translated: What are the objects such as form, etc.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas mthong ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas mthong ba //
translated: Moreover, the yogin sees

original: dngos po de kun dag pa ste //
analyzed: dngos po de kun dag pa ste //
translated: all those entities as pure,

original: gang phyir sangs rgyas 'gro rang bzhin //
analyzed: gang phyir sangs rgyas 'gro rang bzhin //
translated: because the nature of the Buddha is the nature of the world.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi phung po drug dang / yul drug rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi phung po drug dang / yul drug rnams so //
translated: The six aggregates and the six sense objects such as form are the objects.

original: gang gzhan yang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang zhes pa ni /
translated: Moreover,

original: dbang po drug dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga'o //
translated: the six sense faculties and the five great elements.

original: 'di thams cad rnal 'byor bas gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gang so sor snang ba de dang de thams cad gnyi ga rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad rnal 'byor bas gnyi ga dbyer med par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid gang so sor snang ba de dang de thams cad gnyi ga rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: The yogin realizes all this as the identity of the indivisibility of the two, and all that appears individually is the purity of the two.

original: gang gi phyir ni rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of what? Because of the cause.

original: sangs rgyas rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of the Buddha

original: ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of the one gnosis.

original: 'gro ba ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni khams gsum mo //
translated: The world is the three realms.

original: gang rnam par ma dag pa de med pa thams cad nyid rnal 'byor ma'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par ma dag pa de med pa thams cad nyid rnal 'byor ma'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: What is impure does not exist at all. The yoginī’s purity is everything.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin na de la don dam par rnam par dag pa nyid zhog gi / lha'i rnam par dag pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'i rtog pa blo la bzhag nas rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin na de la don dam par rnam par dag pa nyid zhog gi / lha'i rnam par dag pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'i rtog pa blo la bzhag nas rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
translated: Having placed this thought in his mind, Vajragarbha asked:

original: kye bcom ldan 'das rnam par ma dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das rnam par ma dag pa gang lags /
translated: “Oh Bhagavān, what is impure?

original: gang lha'i rnam pas rnam par dag par bya ste byar med ces pa'o //
analyzed: gang lha'i rnam pas rnam par dag par bya ste byar med ces pa'o //
translated: What is purified by the deity? What is not to be done?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Form and so on.”

original: ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs mi shes sgrib pa de'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs mi shes sgrib pa de'o //
translated: Afflictions and ignorance are obscurations.

original: mi shes nyon mongs sgrib pa nyid mdor bstan nas rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: mi shes nyon mongs sgrib pa nyid mdor bstan nas rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: Having briefly explained ignorance and afflictions as obscurations, he explains them extensively:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang gang lags /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang gang lags /
translated: What are apprehended objects and apprehending subjects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: mig gis gzugs ni gzung bar bya //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs ni gzung bar bya //
translated: “The eye apprehends forms.

original: sgra ni rna bas mnyan par bya //
analyzed: sgra ni rna bas mnyan par bya //
translated: Sound is heard by the ear.

original: dri ni sna yis tshor bar bya //
analyzed: dri ni sna yis tshor bar bya //
translated: Smell is sensed by the nose.

original: lce yis ro ni myang bar bya //
analyzed: lce yis ro ni myang bar bya //
translated: The tongue experiences taste.

original: dngos po lus kyis reg par bya //
analyzed: dngos po lus kyis reg par bya //
translated: The body experiences tangible objects.

original: yid kyis bde sogs 'dzin pa yi //🔽gzugs mig gi yul du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis bde sogs 'dzin pa yi // gzugs mig gi yul du bya ba yin te /
translated: The mind apprehends pleasure and so forth.🔽Form is the object of the eye.

original: mig la gzung ba gzugs so //
analyzed: mig la gzung ba gzugs so //
translated: The eye is the apprehender of form.

original: sgra ni rna bas mnyan par bya //
analyzed: sgra ni rna bas mnyan par bya //
translated: Sound is heard by the ear.

original: sgra ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: Sound is the object of apprehension.

original: rna ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The ear is the apprehender.

original: dri ni sna yis tshor bar bya //
analyzed: dri ni sna yis tshor bar bya //
translated: Smell is experienced by the nose.

original: sna ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sna ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nose is the apprehender.

original: dri ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ni gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: Smell is the object of apprehension.

original: lce yis ro ni myang bar bya /
analyzed: lce yis ro ni myang bar bya /
translated: Taste is experienced by the tongue.

original: lce ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lce ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The tongue is the apprehender.

original: myang ba ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: myang ba ni gzung ba'o //
translated: Experience is the object of apprehension.

original: dngos po lus kyi reg par bya //
analyzed: dngos po lus kyi reg par bya //
translated: Tangible objects are experienced by the body.

original: lus ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The body is the apprehender.

original: dngos po gzung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzung ba'o //
translated: Tangible objects are the objects of apprehension.

original: yid kyis bde sogs rig pa yin //
analyzed: yid kyis bde sogs rig pa yin //
translated: Pleasure and so forth are known by the mind.

original: yid ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The mind is the apprehender.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba'o //🔽'dir ni gzung ba dang 'dzin @107a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gzung ba'o // 'dir ni gzung ba dang 'dzin @107a * //
translated: Pleasure and so forth are the objects of apprehension.

original: pa'i mngon par zhen pas rnam par ma dag pa de rnam par dag pa bsten par bya ba yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa'i mngon par zhen pas rnam par ma dag pa de rnam par dag pa bsten par bya ba yin par gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the impure [mind] that is fixated on the apprehended and apprehender is taught to be purified.

original: dag pas dug med byas nas ni //
analyzed: dag pas dug med byas nas ni //
translated: Having made it free from poison by means of purification,

original: bsten bya 'di dag bsten pa nyid //
analyzed: bsten bya 'di dag bsten pa nyid //
translated: one should resort to these objects of resort.

original: 'di yi don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: 'di yi don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: phung po la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas /
translated: That which is impure by the adherence to subject and object in the aggregates, etc.

original: rnam par ma dag pa de yang lha'i rnam pas rnam par dag na chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa de yang lha'i rnam pas rnam par dag na chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: is purified by the aspect of deity, and becomes the nature of the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: dag pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: dag pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Purity is stated:

original: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje ma yin te //
translated: The aggregate of form is Vajrāṅkuśī,

original: tshor ba la yang dkar mor brjod //🔽'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: tshor ba la yang dkar mor brjod // 'du shes chu yi rnal 'byor ma //
translated: and feeling is declared to be Pāṇḍaravāsinī.🔽Perception is Vāriyoginī,

original: 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ;
analyzed: 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ;
translated: and volitions are Vajraḍākinī.

original: / rnam shes phung po'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: / rnam shes phung po'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness, by its very nature,

original: bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
analyzed: bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
translated: is Nairātmyāyoginī.

original: phung po ni nam mkhar 'dus pas na nam mkha'i khams su grags pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po ni nam mkhar 'dus pas na nam mkha'i khams su grags pa yin no //
translated: The aggregates are known as the space element because they are collected into space.

original: gzugs mtha' yas pa des na gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs mtha' yas pa des na gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: Since it is infinite form, it is the aggregate of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba mtha' yas pa des na tshor ba'i phung po'o //🔽'du shes mtha' yas pa des na 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba mtha' yas pa des na tshor ba'i phung po'o // 'du shes mtha' yas pa des na 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Likewise, since there are infinite feelings, there is the aggregate of feeling.🔽Since there are infinite discriminations, there is the aggregate of discrimination.

original: 'du byed mtha' yas pa des na 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mtha' yas pa des na 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: Since there are infinite compositional factors, there is the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa des na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa des na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Since there are infinite consciousnesses, there is the aggregate of consciousness.

original: 'dis ni phung po lnga mkha' 'gro ma lngar rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po lnga mkha' 'gro ma lngar rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of the five aggregates as the five dakinis.

original: de ltar phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are pure.

original: 'di rnams rtag tu dag pas ni //
analyzed: 'di rnams rtag tu dag pas ni //
translated: Since these are always pure,

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pas nges 'grub //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pas nges 'grub //
translated: the yogin is certainly accomplished.

original: 'di rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rnam par dag pas so //
translated: These are the purities of the dakinis.

original: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Always means without interruption.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ni means “because.”

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rgyun ma chad par rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rgyun ma chad par rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Because the five aggregates of form and so on are pure without interruption,

original: de nyid de nyid rnal 'byor pas ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de nyid rnal 'byor pas ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The yogin of reality is endowed with reality.

original: de nyid nges pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid nges pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of reality is ascertainment.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain the power of the great seal.

original: dbang ldan du ni pukka s'i //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ni pukka s'i //
translated: In the northeast is Pukkasī,

original: mer ni de bzhin ri khrod ma //🔽bden bral gdol pa mo bzhag cing //
analyzed: mer ni de bzhin ri khrod ma // bden bral gdol pa mo bzhag cing //
translated: and in the southeast is likewise Śavarī,🔽in the southwest is Caṇḍālī,

original: rlung ru g-yung mo rnam par 'dod //
analyzed: rlung ru g-yung mo rnam par 'dod //
translated: and in the northwest is Ḍombinī.

original: phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pas /
translated: The teaching of the arrangement of the directions

original: phyogs skyong mnan pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyogs skyong mnan pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: is the four great elements, the purities of the four great elements, the purities of the four ḍākinīs, the four supine nāgas.

original: de nas phyi'i 'phar ma bshad //
analyzed: de nas phyi'i 'phar ma bshad //
translated: Then the outer extension is explained.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is

original: de nas ni rjes thogs su bar ma chad par ro //🔽phyi'i 'phar ma ni phyi rol du 'byung bas phyi'o //
analyzed: de nas ni rjes thogs su bar ma chad par ro // phyi'i 'phar ma ni phyi rol du 'byung bas phyi'o //
translated: the next, without interruption.🔽The outer extension is outer because it occurs outside.

original: phyi yang yin @107b la 'phar ma yang de yin pas phyi'i 'phar ma ste /
analyzed: phyi yang yin @107b la 'phar ma yang de yin pas phyi'i 'phar ma ste /
translated: It is outer and an extension, thus it is the outer extension.

original: phyi rol ni nang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi rol ni nang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the external is devoid of the characteristic of the internal.

original: nang dang lhan cig tu kun du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nang dang lhan cig tu kun du sbyar ba'o //
translated: It is the union with the internal.

original: de bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang dbyer med par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang dbyer med par bstan par bya'o //
translated: That is explained, that is to be taught, that is to be taught as inseparable from the conventional truth.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: phyi ma lha mo dkar mo sogs /
analyzed: phyi ma lha mo dkar mo sogs /
translated: The subsequent, the white goddess, etc.

original: gang la gzhan dang dbyer yod pa ma yin pa de ni phyi ma ste /
analyzed: gang la gzhan dang dbyer yod pa ma yin pa de ni phyi ma ste /
translated: That which is not different from another is the subsequent.

original: phyi ma yang yin la dkar mo la sogs pa yang de yin pas phyi ma lha mo dkar mo la sogs pa te dbyer med pas gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: phyi ma yang yin la dkar mo la sogs pa yang de yin pas phyi ma lha mo dkar mo la sogs pa te dbyer med pas gcig gi tshig go //
translated: It is subsequent and it is the white goddess, etc., therefore it is the subsequent white goddess, etc. The word “one” is because of non-difference.

original: de nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa /
translated: That itself is taught:🔽The white one is in the east, Yama in the south,🔽the thief in the west, and Vetāla in the north.

original: dbang dkar gshin rje chom rkun ma //
analyzed: dbang dkar gshin rje chom rkun ma //
translated: Kubera is in the northeast,

original: chu bdag tu ni ro langs ma //
analyzed: chu bdag tu ni ro langs ma //
translated: and Pūtanā is below.🔽Bhūtanāyaka is in the southeast,

original: lus ngan por ni gha sma r'i //
analyzed: lus ngan por ni gha sma r'i //
translated: and Ghasmarī is in the southwest.🔽Padminī is in the northwest,🔽and Śavarī is in the northeast.🔽The one above is called Khaṇḍarohā.🔽The one below is called Bhūcarī.🔽The one in the east is called Gaurī.🔽The one in the south is called Cāmuṇḍā.🔽The one in the west is called Vetālī.🔽The one in the north is called Ghasmarī.🔽The one in the northeast is called Pukkasī.🔽The one in the southeast is called Caṇḍālī.

original: 'og tu sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
analyzed: 'og tu sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
translated: The one in the southwest is called Ḍombinī.🔽The one in the northwest is called Śavarī.🔽The one above is called Khaṇḍarohā.🔽The one below is called Bhūcarī.🔽The one in the east is called Gaurī.🔽The one in the south is called Cāmuṇḍā.🔽The one in the west is called Vetālī.

original: steng du mkha' spyod ma zhes bshad //🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid kyi phyogs //
analyzed: steng du mkha' spyod ma zhes bshad // bskyed pa'i rim pa nyid kyi phyogs //
translated: The one in the north is called Ghasmarī.🔽The one in the northeast is called Pukkasī.🔽The one in the southeast is called Caṇḍālī.🔽The one in the southwest is called Ḍombinī.🔽The one in the northwest is called Śavarī.🔽The one above is called Khaṇḍarohā.🔽The one below is called Bhūcarī.

original: goo r'i ni dbang po mnan pa'o //
analyzed: goo r'i ni dbang po mnan pa'o //
translated: The one in the east is called Gaurī.🔽The one in the south is called Cāmuṇḍā.🔽The one in the

original: chom rkun ma ni gshin rje mnan pa'o //
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni gshin rje mnan pa'o //
translated: The thief is on top of Yama.

original: chu bdag ni ro langs mnan pa'o //
analyzed: chu bdag ni ro langs mnan pa'o //
translated: The lord of waters is on top of the zombie.

original: gha sma r'i ni lus ngan po mnan pa'o //🔽sngar gyi dbang ldan la sogs pa mtshams skyong ba bzhi mnan pa mtshams bzhir khyab pa'i pukka s'i la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: gha sma r'i ni lus ngan po mnan pa'o // sngar gyi dbang ldan la sogs pa mtshams skyong ba bzhi mnan pa mtshams bzhir khyab pa'i pukka s'i la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
translated: The ghasmarī is on top of the evil spirit.🔽The four yoginīs beginning with pukkasī, who pervade the four directions, are on top of the four guardians of the directions beginning with Indra, who were previously mentioned.

original: 'di yang dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba bzhi mnan pas phyogs bzhir khyab pa'i dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di yang dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyong ba bzhi mnan pas phyogs bzhir khyab pa'i dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bzhi'o //
translated: The four yoginīs beginning with gaurī, who pervade the four directions, are on top of the four guardians of the directions beginning with Indra.

original: steng dang 'og gnyis kyi phyogs gnyis su khyab pas spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i mkha' 'gro ma gnyis so //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gnyis kyi phyogs gnyis su khyab pas spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i mkha' 'gro ma gnyis so //
translated: The two yoginīs, carcikā and khaṇḍarohā, pervade the two directions above and below.

original: de ltar phyogs brgyad du 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad mnan pas phyogs brgyad khyab pas mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs brgyad du 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad mnan pas phyogs brgyad khyab pas mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
translated: Thus, the eight yoginīs pervade the eight directions, being on top of the eight guardians of the directions.

original: 'dis ni phyogs bcu rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma bcu'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs bcu rnam par dag pas mkha' 'gro ma bcu'o //
translated: Thus, the ten yoginīs pervade the ten directions.

original: sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i mkha' 'gro ma gnyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te /🔽srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma'i mkha' 'gro ma gnyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te / srid dang zhi ba'i rang bzhin las //
translated: The two dakinis, the earth-dwelling and the sky-dwelling, are the purities of cyclic life and of nirvana.

original: lha mo 'di gnyis rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lha mo 'di gnyis rnam par gnas //
translated: These two goddesses

original: srid pa'i rang bzhin gyis sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rang bzhin gyis sa spyod ma'o //
translated: are situated in the natures of cyclic life and of nirvana.🔽The earth-dwelling dakini is situated in the nature of cyclic life.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: The sky-dwelling dakini is situated in the nature of nirvana.

original: 'dis ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ye shes 'di dag gi rnam par gnas pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ye shes 'di dag gi rnam par gnas pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This shows that cyclic life and nirvana are the firm and moving natures of the situations of these two knowledges.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: lha mo gnyis so //
analyzed: lha mo gnyis so //
translated: The two goddesses.

original: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purities of white, etc., are stated:

original: gzugs la dkar mor rtag tu bshad //
analyzed: gzugs la dkar mor rtag tu bshad //
translated: White is always declared in form.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pas dkar mo'o //🔽sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags //🔽sgra rnam par dag @108a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pas dkar mo'o // sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags // sgra rnam par dag @108a * //
translated: White is in the purity of form.🔽In sound, the famous is the robber.

original: pas chom rkun ma'o //🔽dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
analyzed: pas chom rkun ma'o // dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
translated: The robber is in the purity of sound.🔽In the part of smell, the zombie.

original: dri rnam par dag pas ro langs ma'o //
analyzed: dri rnam par dag pas ro langs ma'o //
translated: The zombie is in the purity of smell.

original: ro la gha sma r'i rab grags /
analyzed: ro la gha sma r'i rab grags /
translated: The famous one in taste is Ghasmarī.

original: ro rnam par dag pas gha sma r'i'o //🔽reg la sa spyod ma zhes bshad //
analyzed: ro rnam par dag pas gha sma r'i'o // reg la sa spyod ma zhes bshad //
translated: She is Ghasmarī because of the purity of taste.🔽The one in touch is called Saṃbhavate.

original: reg bya rnam par dag pas sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: reg bya rnam par dag pas sa spyod ma'o //
translated: She is Saṃbhavate because of the purity of touch.

original: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mkha' spyod ma /
translated: The one in the realm of phenomena is Khecarī.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: She is Khecarī because of the purity of the suchness of the realm of phenomena.

original: 'di rnams rtag tu dag pas ni //
analyzed: 'di rnams rtag tu dag pas ni //
translated: The yogi/nī who is always pure

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pas 'grub 'gyur //
translated: will accomplish reality.

original: 'di rnams ni goo r'i la sogs pa 'di rnams dang 'brel pa can gyi gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa nges so //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni goo r'i la sogs pa 'di rnams dang 'brel pa can gyi gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa nges so //
translated: These are the purities of form and so forth that are related to Gaurī and so forth.

original: rtag tu ni rtag tu bar ma chad par ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ni rtag tu bar ma chad par ro //
translated: Always means uninterruptedly.

original: gang gi tshe gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that is the case,

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba yin pas de nyid rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ba yin pas de nyid rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: the yogi/nī is endowed with the yoga of reality, and so is the one who is the yoga.

original: 'grub 'gyur ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Will accomplish means will attain the mahāmudrā attainment.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: In order to teach that the inseparability of the two maṇḍalas is the purity of the yoginī maṇḍala, the nature of the dharmadhātu, the vajra holder, and the purity of the inseparability of Nairātmya, it is said:

original: phyag gi dag pa stong pa nyid /🔽phyag ni bcu drug stong pa nyid //
analyzed: phyag gi dag pa stong pa nyid / phyag ni bcu drug stong pa nyid //
translated: The purity of the hands is emptiness.🔽The sixteen hands are the emptinesses.

original: ces pas stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa nyid phyag bcu drug go //
analyzed: ces pas stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa nyid phyag bcu drug go //
translated: The purity of the sixteen emptinesses is the sixteen hands.

original: bdud dag pa las zhabs rnams nyid //
analyzed: bdud dag pa las zhabs rnams nyid //
translated: The feet are the purity of the māras.

original: ces pa ni skye ba tsam gyis zhabs dag la //
analyzed: ces pa ni skye ba tsam gyis zhabs dag la //
translated: The feet are pure by mere birth.

original: zhes pas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //🔽rnam thar brgyad kyis zhal rnams nyid ni zhal brgyad rnam par dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o // rnam thar brgyad kyis zhal rnams nyid ni zhal brgyad rnam par dag pa rnams so //
translated: The purity of the four māras is the four feet.🔽The faces are the eight liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pas /
translated: The purity of the eight liberations is the eight faces.

original: rdo rje gsum gyis dag pa'i spyan //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyis dag pa'i spyan //
translated: The eyes are the purity of the three vajras.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni phyag dang zhabs dang zhal dang spyan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o //🔽stong pa nyid bcu drug ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni phyag dang zhabs dang zhal dang spyan rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'o // stong pa nyid bcu drug ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: This verse describes the purity of his hands, feet, face, and eyes.🔽The sixteen kinds of emptiness are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the conditioned,🔽the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the infinite, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of specific characteristics, and the emptiness of the absence of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid @108b dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid @108b dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of the non-apprehension of phenomena, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the emptiness of existence, the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of its own nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: and the emptiness of other natures.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'di nyid du dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid dang bzhi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'di nyid du dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid dang bzhi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug go //
translated: Since these four, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of existence, the emptiness of non-existence, and the emptiness of its own nature and the emptiness of other natures, are included in this emptiness of non-apprehension, there are sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: mig la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams de mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pas na nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nang gi chos rnams de mig la sogs pa rnams nyid kyis stong pas na nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena refers to the fact that the eyes and so forth, which are internal phenomena, are empty of their own nature.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi chos rnams gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi chos rnams gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: External phenomena, objects such as form, are empty of form and so on.

original: phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of the external.

original: nang gi mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis stong pa la /
analyzed: nang gi mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams phyi'i chos gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis stong pa la /
translated: Internal phenomena, the eyes and so forth, are empty of external phenomena, the objects such as form.

original: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams nang gi mig la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pas phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams nang gi mig la sogs pa rnams kyis stong pas phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: External objects such as form are empty of the internal, the eyes and so forth. This is the emptiness of the external and the internal.

original: chos kun stong pa'i chos rnams kun stong pa yin pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kun stong pa'i chos rnams kun stong pa yin pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena are empty of all phenomena. This is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis shar la sogs pa'i phyogs stong pas na chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis shar la sogs pa'i phyogs stong pas na chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The directions such as east are empty of the directions such as east. This is the emptiness of the great.

original: don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa des stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa des stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since that which is empty of the ultimate is nirvana, this is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams 'dus byas pa de de nyid kyis stong pas na 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams 'dus byas pa de de nyid kyis stong pas na 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The conditioned is empty of the conditioned itself, because the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are conditioned.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i stong pa 'dus ma byas pa des de stong pas na 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i stong pa 'dus ma byas pa des de stong pas na 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned is empty of the unconditioned itself, because the unconditioned is empty of the unconditioned, such as arising, ceasing, and so on.

original: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes?

original: gang gi mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
translated: The extreme is not apprehended in what is beyond extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa mtha' las 'das pas stong par brjod pa 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa mtha' las 'das pas stong par brjod pa 'di ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa'o //
translated: What is beyond extremes is empty of what is beyond extremes. This is called the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of no beginning and no end?

original: gang gi thog ma med cing tha ma mi dmigs pa de'i dbus kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gi thog ma med cing tha ma mi dmigs pa de'i dbus kyang med do //
translated: What has no beginning and no end is also without middle.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: What has no beginning and no end

original: des de stong pa yin pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des de stong pa yin pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: is empty of itself. This is called the emptiness of no beginning and no end.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni /
translated: is the emptiness of the fact that no phenomenon is discarded,🔽transferred, or given up, and that it is empty of itself.🔽The emptiness of nature

original: chos gang gis yang dor nas spros shing btang la phyang ba de de bzhin du dor ba ma yin pa des stong pas na dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos gang gis yang dor nas spros shing btang la phyang ba de de bzhin du dor ba ma yin pa des stong pas na dor ba med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: is the emptiness of the fact that the nature of all phenomena,

original: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas @109a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas @109a * //
translated: whether compounded or uncompounded, is not created by it.

original: pa'i chos rnams gang gi rang bzhin te /🔽de des stong pa yin pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i chos rnams gang gi rang bzhin te / de des stong pa yin pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: is the emptiness of the defining characteristics of form and so forth, and of the aggregates of form and so forth.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de dang des stong pas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de dang des stong pas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: is the emptiness of the fact that all phenomena, such as the five aggregates, are empty of themselves.🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'das pa'i dus su med cing ma 'ongs pa 'das pa med la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'das pa'i dus su med cing ma 'ongs pa 'das pa med la /
translated: is the emptiness of the fact that compounded phenomena do not exist in the past, do not exist in the future, and do not remain in the present.🔽The emptiness of the beginningless and endless

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos kyang da ltar byung ba 'das pa la med cing /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos kyang da ltar byung ba 'das pa la med cing /
translated: is the emptiness of the fact that phenomena do not come into being in the past, do not cease in the future, and do not remain in the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dag da ltar byung bar mi dmigs pa yin pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dag da ltar byung bar mi dmigs pa yin pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since the future and the past are not apprehended in the present, this is the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: chos thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba med cing rang bzhin gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yang dag par sbyor ba des sbyor bas na dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi yang dag par sbyor ba med cing rang bzhin gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yang dag par sbyor ba des sbyor bas na dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are not really connected and are naturally connected with dependent origination, they are non-existent.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid sbyor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid sbyor ba rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Since the emptiness of intrinsic nature is connected with the emptiness of non-existence, it is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: The existent refers to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de yang dngos po ni dngos po med par stong pas na dngos po stong pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos po ni dngos po med par stong pas na dngos po stong pa'o //
translated: Since the existent is empty of the existent, it is the emptiness of the existent.

original: dngos med ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽des de stong pas na dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos med ni 'dus ma byas pa'o // des de stong pas na dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existent refers to the unconditioned.🔽Since that is empty of that, it is the emptiness of the non-existent.

original: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa de nyid des stong pas na rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ni rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa de nyid des stong pas na rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid do //
translated: One’s own nature is the unmistaken intrinsic nature. Since that is empty of that, it is the emptiness of one’s own nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ma byung yang rung gnas kyang rung ba 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ma byung yang rung gnas kyang rung ba 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos mi 'gyur ba nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Whether or not the Tathagatas arise, this is the true nature of things, the stability of things, the invariability of things, thusness, non-erroneous thusness,🔽unerring thusness, the limit of what is real, and the ultimate.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang de rnams nges gang stong pa nyid de ni gzhan gyi dngos po'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang de rnams nges gang stong pa nyid de ni gzhan gyi dngos po'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: That emptiness is the emptiness of other things.

original: de las gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di nyid du stong pa nyid bzhi khongs su 'dus pas stong pa nyid bcu drug gzung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan med pa'i phyir 'di nyid du stong pa nyid bzhi khongs su 'dus pas stong pa nyid bcu drug gzung ngo //
translated: Since it is not different from that, the four emptinesses are included in this one, and so there are held to be sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: bdud dag pa las zhabs rnams nyid //
analyzed: bdud dag pa las zhabs rnams nyid //
translated: The four demons are the demons of the aggregates,

original: ces pa ni phung po'i bdud tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni phung po'i bdud tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The demon of the aggregates is in the form of Brahma.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The demon of afflictions is in the form of a yaksha.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
translated: The demon of the Lord of Death is in the form of Yama.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud brgya byin gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud brgya byin gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The devaputra Māra has the form of Śakra.

original: 'di rnams kyi rnam par rgyal bas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rnam par rgyal bas bdud bzhi rnam par dag pas zhabs bzhi'o //
translated: Since these are the four feet through the purity of the four māras,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pa'i zhal ni brgyad de //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pa'i zhal ni brgyad de //
translated: the eight faces are the purity of the eight liberations.🔽The eight liberations are the faces of emptiness,

original: ltong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa @109b dar ;
analyzed: ltong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa @109b dar ;
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: ; rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rnams mi dge ba med pa'i n'a da gang rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi zhal te /
analyzed: ; rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid rnams mi dge ba med pa'i n'a da gang rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi zhal te /
translated: The eight faces of the eight liberations are the nāḍīs that are the nature of the pure light of the absence of nonvirtue.

original: de rnam par dag pas zhal rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas zhal rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since they are pure, the faces are pure.

original: gzugs can gyis gzugs mthong ba stong pa dang / nang gi gzugs rnams mthong ba stong ba dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba stong pa dang / skye mched kyis skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs can gyis gzugs mthong ba stong pa dang / nang gi gzugs rnams mthong ba stong ba dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba stong pa dang / skye mched kyis skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang /
translated: The emptiness of seeing form with form, the emptiness of seeing internal forms, the emptiness of seeing external forms, the emptiness of seeing the sense bases with the sense bases, the emptiness of seeing the sense base of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i skye mched mthong ba stong pa nyid dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched mthong ba stong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched mthong ba stong pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i skye mched mthong ba stong pa nyid dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched mthong ba stong ba'o //
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness is the emptiness of the seen. The sphere of nothingness is the emptiness of the seen.

original: spyan rnams ni sku gsung thugs dag pa rdo rje gsum rnam pa da pa'o //
analyzed: spyan rnams ni sku gsung thugs dag pa rdo rje gsum rnam pa da pa'o //
translated: The eyes are the purity of body, speech, and mind, the three vajras.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of the great elements is stated:

original: sa ni pukka s'i zhes bshad //
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'i zhes bshad //
translated: Earth is said to be Pukkasī.

original: chu khams rngon pa ma ru bshad //
analyzed: chu khams rngon pa ma ru bshad //
translated: The water element is said to be Rāvaṇī.

original: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
analyzed: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
translated: Fire is known as Caṇḍālī.

original: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
translated: Wind is renowned as Ḍombinī.

original: zhes pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnam par dag pa mkha' 'gro ma bzhi rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the purity of the four great elements is the purity of the four dakinis.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of hatred and so on is stated:

original: zhe sdang zhes bshad 'khor lo can //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bshad 'khor lo can //
translated: Hatred is said to be Cakriṇī.

original: 'khor lo can zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i bdag po bdag med ma de zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo can zhes pa ni 'khor lo'i bdag po bdag med ma de zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Cakriṇī, the lady of the wheel, Nairātmyā, is the purity of hatred.

original: zhe sdang mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Hatred is Akṣobhya.

original: de ltar rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
translated: Thus Nairātmya is inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: 'dod chags chu'i rnal 'byor ma de ni 'dod chags kyi rnam par dag pas 'dod chags 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chu'i rnal 'byor ma de ni 'dod chags kyi rnam par dag pas 'dod chags 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Rati is Vāriyoginī. Since she is the purification of passion, passion is Amitābha.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa chu'i rnal 'byor ma ste 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa'i chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa chu'i rnal 'byor ma ste 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa'i chu'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Her purification is Vāriyoginī. Thus Vāriyoginī is inseparable from Amitābha.

original: phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ;
analyzed: phrag dog rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ;
translated: Jealousy is Vajraḍāka.

original: / phrag dog rnam par dag pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yin pas de dang dbyer med pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: / phrag dog rnam par dag pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yin pas de dang dbyer med pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: Since jealousy is purified, Vajraḍāka is Amoghasiddhi. Thus Vajraḍāka is the purification of Amoghasiddhi. The meaning is that she is inseparable from him.

original: pha ma yang gsang ba'i dkar mo nyid //
analyzed: pha ma yang gsang ba'i dkar mo nyid //
translated: The mother and father are the secret Gaurī.

original: ches pa ni pha ma'i rnam par dag pas nang gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rin chen gtso'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med pa nyid yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: ches pa ni pha ma'i rnam par dag pas nang gi rim par gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rin chen gtso'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir de dang dbyer med pa nyid yin pa'i don to //
translated: Since the mother and father are purified, the inner Gaurī is the purification of Ratnatraya. The meaning is that she is inseparable from him.

original: gti mug rdo rjer bshad ces pa ni /
analyzed: gti mug rdo rjer bshad ces pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “vajra of delusion” is as follows.

original: gti mug rnam par dag pas rdo rje ma rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir rdo rje ma gang de dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje ma'o //🔽'dis ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam @110a * //
analyzed: gti mug rnam par dag pas rdo rje ma rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir rdo rje ma gang de dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje ma'o // 'dis ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam @110a * //
translated: Since the vajra woman is the purification of Vairocana, the vajra woman is inseparable from that vajra woman who is the purification of delusion.

original: par dag pa zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pas na /
analyzed: par dag pa zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam par dag pas na /
translated: By this, the purification of hatred, etc., is the purification of hatred, etc.

original: nang gi rim par gnas pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rim par gnas pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lnga yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five dakinis are inseparable from Vajradhara, who is situated in the inner sequence.

original: rim pa 'dis phung po'i rnam par dag pa yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis phung po'i rnam par dag pa yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: By this sequence, the purification of the aggregates is stated.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
translated: By the side of the creation stage,

original: 'dis ni phung po sbyang bar bya //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po sbyang bar bya //
translated: the aggregates are to be purified.

original: rim pa 'dis phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis phung po ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: By this sequence, the aggregates are the five aggregates of form, etc.

original: sbyang bar bya ni dri ma med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyang bar bya ni dri ma med par byed pa'o //
translated: To be purified is to be made stainless.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs las ni //
translated: By the side of the creation stage,

original: lha yi rnam pa nyid las so //
analyzed: lha yi rnam pa nyid las so //
translated: from the form of the deity.

original: yang na bskyed pa'i sgras //
analyzed: yang na bskyed pa'i sgras //
translated: Or, by the word “creation”

original: las 'byung bar 'jug pas na bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: las 'byung bar 'jug pas na bskyed pa ste /
translated: It is generated because it engages in the arising of karma.

original: las bkrabs pa'i ye shes nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir de rim par rnyed pa yin pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: las bkrabs pa'i ye shes nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir de rim par rnyed pa yin pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is the result of karma is the stage of generation because it is attained in stages, since it is not the domain of experience of śrāvakas and so on.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also because it is the nature of correct wisdom.🔽How is that?

original: ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: phyogs las te rnam pa gnyi ga las kyang yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs las te rnam pa gnyi ga las kyang yin pa'i don to //
translated: From the perspective, and also from both aspects.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid tha mi dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid tha mi dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate are not different from the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin par rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin par rab tu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, in order to clearly demonstrate that the indivisibility of the conventional and the ultimate is correct wisdom, it is said:

original: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching gyur pa //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'jig rten 'ching gyur pa //
translated: Whatever and however the world is bound,

original: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
analyzed: de dang des ni 'ching ba las grol te //
translated: By that and by that it is liberated from bondage.

original: de nyid mi shes 'jig rten mi grol zhing //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes 'jig rten mi grol zhing //
translated: The world is not liberated without knowing that.

original: de nyid rnam spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid rnam spangs dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: One does not attain power without abandoning that.

original: gang dang gang ni 'dod chas la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gang dang gang ni 'dod chas la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By whatever means, i.e., by the attachment to form, etc.

original: 'jig rten 'ching ba ni 'khor ba'i 'ching bas bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'ching ba ni 'khor ba'i 'ching bas bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: The world is bound by the bondage of saṃsāra.

original: de dang des ni 'ching ba las ni 'khor bar 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: de dang des ni 'ching ba las ni 'khor bar 'dzin pa las so //
translated: By that, i.e., by the bondage of saṃsāra, one is bound by the grasping of saṃsāra.

original: grol te ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol te ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Liberated, one is liberated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten mi grol te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten mi grol te /
translated: Therefore, the world is not liberated.

original: gti mug gi 'khrul pas bsgribs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi 'khrul pas bsgribs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is obscured by the delusion of nescience.

original: de nyid mi shes ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs shing de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs shing de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not knowing reality, i.e., not understanding reality, not realizing reality,

original: dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur ni dngos grub mi 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur ni dngos grub mi 'thob pa'o //
translated: one does not attain power, i.e., one does not obtain power.

original: yang na 'jig rten ni phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten ni phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: Or else, the world is the five aggregates.

original: gang dang gang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: By whatever means, i.e., by the attachment to the objects of form, etc.

original: 'ching ba ni mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: Bondage is attachment.

original: 'ching ba ni mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Bondage is the state of being attached.

original: de dang des ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang des ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis 'ching ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, those who are attached to form, etc. are liberated from bondage.

original: @110b 'jig rten mi grol te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: @110b 'jig rten mi grol te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The world is not liberated. How so?

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ma shes pas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ma shes pas so //
translated: Because the nature of reality is not known.

original: de nyid rnam spangs ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam spangs ni /
translated: The nature of reality is abandoned.

original: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa dang bral bas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa dang bral bas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being devoid of the knowledge of the nature, one does not attain the perfection of the Great Seal.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa las dngos grub yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid yongs su shes pa las dngos grub yin no //
translated: Therefore, perfection comes from the knowledge of the nature of the extremely pure Dharma-dhātu.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: bsgribs pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because of being obscured, one would revolve in saṃsāra.

original: de'i phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
analyzed: de'i phyir dri med sgra med gzugs nyid med //
translated: Therefore, there is no sound, no form, no stainlessness,

original: ro dang sems kyi rnams par dag pa med //
analyzed: ro dang sems kyi rnams par dag pa med //
translated: no purity of taste, no purity of mind,🔽no touch, no dharma, everything is pure.

original: reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro bar shes //
analyzed: reg med chos med thams cad rnam par dag / rang bzhin dag pa'i 'gro bar shes //
translated: One should know the world as pure by nature.

original: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs med cing ro yang med do //
analyzed: de phyir dri med sgra med gzugs med cing ro yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no sound, no form, no smell, and no taste.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
