analyzed: gso ba zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad sems dang ldan par 'dod pa gang rnams kyi lta ba'o // thams cad ces pa ni rgyal po'i bstan bcos su shes par bya'o //
translated: The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.

original: dus zhes pa ni dus byed pa por 'dod pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: dus zhes pa ni dus byed pa por 'dod pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.🔽The view of the person is included in that.

original: dus kyis smin par gyur pa rnams //
analyzed: dus kyis smin par gyur pa rnams //
translated: Those that are ripened by time

original: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
translated: are gathered by time into the multitudes.

original: ces gang gi'o //
analyzed: ces gang gi'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gang zag ni nyan thos kyi'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni nyan thos kyi'o //
translated: The person is that of the śrāvakas.

original: 'dis ni lta ba sna tshogs la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi gang dang gang gi lta ba'i ye shes de thams cad nyi tshe ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni lta ba sna tshogs la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi gang dang gang gi lta ba'i ye shes de thams cad nyi tshe ba ste /
translated: This shows that all the wisdoms of the various views of those who abide in the various views are limited.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes su thams cad nyid 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes su thams cad nyid 'dus pa yin no //
translated: All of them are included in the wisdom of perfect buddhahood.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la mkhar gyi rgyal phran la sogs pa thams cad nyid zhabs tog gi zho sha 'bul lo //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la mkhar gyi rgyal phran la sogs pa thams cad nyid zhabs tog gi zho sha 'bul lo //
translated: For example, all the minor kings, such as the kings of fortresses, serve the universal monarch.

original: de bzhin du ye shes thams cad nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes der lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes thams cad nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes der lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, all wisdoms are spontaneously present in that perfect wisdom.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa la sogs pa rang nyid mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par sbyin pa la sogs pa rang nyid mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in the perfection of wisdom, generosity and so on manifest themselves.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa grub na cis mi 'grub /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa grub na cis mi 'grub /
translated: In the same way, if the knowledge of all aspects is established here, what is not established?

original: des na gzhan thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes can du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes can du grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all others are established as having the pristine consciousness of Vajradhara.

original: 'on kyang 'di goms pa las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di goms pa las yin te /
translated: However, this is from familiarity.

original: goms pa ma byas na thar pa thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa ma byas na thar pa thob pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no familiarity, liberation is not attained.

original: yang na sems can zhes pa'i ni srid gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na sems can zhes pa'i ni srid gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Or, the one called sentient being is the pristine consciousness of the inseparability of the three existences.

original: rnam shes tshul zhes pa ni ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam shes tshul zhes pa ni ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The method of consciousness is the nature of the superiority of pristine consciousness.

original: skyes bu zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi ma ning ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi ma ning ngo //
translated: The one called person is the nature of Vajradhara, the neutral state.

original: sngon rabs ni thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon rabs ni thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former is the beginning and end, because they are not observed.

original: dbang phyug ces pa ni rang nyid 'phrog po rang nyid byed //
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa ni rang nyid 'phrog po rang nyid byed //
translated: The one called lord is the one who steals himself and does everything himself.

original: ces pas bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pas bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because he is the principal one himself,

original: bdag ces pa ni pha rol na gzhan ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces pa ni pha rol na gzhan ci yang med pa'o //
translated: the one called self is nothing other than the other side.

original: de med pa las bdag kyang med pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa las bdag kyang med pa yin no //
translated: Because that does not exist, the self also does not exist.

original: gso ba zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gso ba zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “Healing” is the form of realization because of being omniscient.

original: thams cad dang zhes pa ni skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad dang zhes pa ni skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Everything” is impermanent because of being free from arising and ceasing.

original: dus zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i @116b rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: dus zhes pa ni rang bzhin med pa'i @116b rang bzhin can no //
translated: “Time” is the nature of being without intrinsic nature.

original: gang zag ces pa ni sprul pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: gang zag ces pa ni sprul pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyi sku'o //
translated: “Person” is the dharmakāya, which has the nature of an emanation.

original: thams cad bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary of everything is stated:

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'di /
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'di /
translated: The nature of all things

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyis yang dag gnas //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs kyis yang dag gnas //
translated: is truly present in the form of an illusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyi srog rnam par shes pas rlung gi de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyi srog rnam par shes pas rlung gi de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of all things is the nature of the life-force of the nature, which is endowed with the reality of the wind of consciousness.

original: 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: How this is so is stated:

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rang bzhin ltar ro //
translated: Like the nature of an illusion.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin par kun gyi rang bzhin no /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin par kun gyi rang bzhin no /
translated: Just as an illusion is neither true nor false, so the nature of everything is the nature of the life-force of the nature, which is endowed with the reality of the wind of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de yang bden pa dang mi bden pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das de yang bden pa dang mi bden pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One is also beyond truth and untruth, permanence and so forth.

original: kun la khyab pas kun gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kun la khyab pas kun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Because of pervading all, he is the nature of all.

original: yang na gnas zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i rim pas mi g-yo ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gnas zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i rim pas mi g-yo ba'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, “abiding” means the nature of non-movement, because of the wisdom of suchness that does not move by the correct stage.

original: de ltar rang rig las ni ye shes 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar rang rig las ni ye shes 'gyur //
translated: Thus, from self-awareness, there is wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: And so forth.

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres //
translated: Intermingled with attachment and non-attachment,

original: zhes pa'i mthar gyis gang gsungs pa de nyid du thams cad khongs su 'dus par bstan nas de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar gyis gang gsungs pa de nyid du thams cad khongs su 'dus par bstan nas de nyid gsal bar gsungs pa /
translated: having taught that everything is included in that, he clearly states that:

original: dang po dga' ba tsam nyid de //
analyzed: dang po dga' ba tsam nyid de //
translated: The first is mere joy.

original: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga' bshad ni de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i grangs las mchog dga' bshad ni de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The second is explained as supreme joy, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: gsum pa la ni rnam dgar bshad //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rnam dgar bshad //
translated: The third is explained as pure.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the three vajras.

original: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par brjod //
analyzed: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par brjod //
translated: The fourth is called innate.

original: ces pa ni lhan cig tu skyes pas ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni lhan cig tu skyes pas ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: The innate is so called because it is born together.

original: sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa nyid yin pa de nyid bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa nyid yin pa de nyid bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ci bstan na dang po 'ba' zhig gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam mo //
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na dang po 'ba' zhig gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tsam mo //
translated: What does this teach? The first is the mere nondual gnosis.

original: de nyid mchog dga' ste thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid mchog dga' ste thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That is supreme joy, which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: grangs ni gnyis pa'i grangs las so //
analyzed: grangs ni gnyis pa'i grangs las so //
translated: The number is from the number two.

original: gsum pa la ni rnam dgar bshad ni gsum po rnams rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rnam dgar bshad ni gsum po rnams rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The third is explained as pure, which is the completion of the three.

original: de nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: de nyid gang las she na /
translated: From what is that?

original: rnam dgar bshad ces pa ste gang las gnyi ga snyoms par 'jug pas khyad par du 'phags pa dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dgar bshad ces pa ste gang las gnyi ga snyoms par 'jug pas khyad par du 'phags pa dga' ba'o //
translated: It is explained as pure, which is the joy that is superior because of the union of both.

original: bzhi pa ni bzhi po rnams rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bzhi po rnams rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the completion of the four.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: lhan cig gcig tu skyes pa ste dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig gcig tu skyes pa ste dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is born together as one, because it is generated as the nature of indivisibility.

original: de yang bshad pa ni ye shes kho na ste shing dang por ba la sogs pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bshad pa ni ye shes kho na ste shing dang por ba la sogs pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the explanation is only pristine awareness, not like a tree, a cow, and so on.

original: 'dis ni gcig @117a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig @117a * //
translated: Here,

original: dang gnyis dang gsum ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang gnyis dang gsum ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: one, two, and three are the connate [joy] of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: dga' ba gsum las log pa'i bzhi pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: dga' ba gsum las log pa'i bzhi pa med pa nyid de /
translated: The fourth, which is the opposite of the three joys, does not exist.

original: 'di ni brtags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni brtags pa tsam yin no //
translated: This is merely an imputation.

original: rdo rje snying po la sogs kun //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po la sogs kun //
translated: All of Vajragarbha and so on

original: mkhas pas de skad nges thos nas //
analyzed: mkhas pas de skad nges thos nas //
translated: heard those words with certainty.

original: mchog tu ngo mtshar gyur nas ni //
analyzed: mchog tu ngo mtshar gyur nas ni //
translated: Having become supremely astonished,

original: brgyal zhing sa la 'gyel bar gyur //
analyzed: brgyal zhing sa la 'gyel bar gyur //
translated: they fainted and fell to the ground.

original: dang po'i dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: dang po'i dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
translated: The form of the world is the first joy,

original: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro ba nyid //
translated: and likewise, the world is the supreme joy.

original: dga' bral dga' ba'ang 'gro ba nyid //🔽gsum la lhan cig skyes pa med //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba'ang 'gro ba nyid // gsum la lhan cig skyes pa med //
translated: The joy of separation from joy is also the world.

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: The three do not have the connate [joy].

original: de ltar thos nas ni /
analyzed: de ltar thos nas ni /
translated: Having heard that,

original: dga' ba nyid kyis dga' ba ni bzhi yin par sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba nyid kyis dga' ba ni bzhi yin par sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: the joy of joy is the fourth, as was previously explained.

original: da ni dga' ba gsum po rnams dbyer med pa gang las dga' ba gsum yang 'gro ba'i gzugs nyid kyis mtshungs so //
analyzed: da ni dga' ba gsum po rnams dbyer med pa gang las dga' ba gsum yang 'gro ba'i gzugs nyid kyis mtshungs so //
translated: Now, the three joys are inseparable, from which the three joys are also equal by the nature of the form of the world.

original: gsum la ni dga' ba gsum rnams la'o //
analyzed: gsum la ni dga' ba gsum rnams la'o //
translated: In the three, in the three joys.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The innate does not exist.

original: thams cad nyid mkhas pas ni rtogs pa la gnas pa'i rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid mkhas pas ni rtogs pa la gnas pa'i rdo rje snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All of them, the wise ones, are the abode of realization, such as the vajra essence and so forth.

original: nges pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Certainty is ascertainment.

original: the tshom nyid kyis mchog tu ngo mtshar bar gyur ba ni /
analyzed: the tshom nyid kyis mchog tu ngo mtshar bar gyur ba ni /
translated: Doubt itself is supremely wondrous.

original: phan tshun du mi bzad pa rtogs nas de the tshom gyi yid du gyur te /
analyzed: phan tshun du mi bzad pa rtogs nas de the tshom gyi yid du gyur te /
translated: Having realized each other's inexhaustibility, he became doubtful.

original: brgyal ba ni gti mug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba ni gti mug par gyur pa'o //
translated: Fainted is becoming deluded.

original: sa ni sa la 'gyel ba'o //
analyzed: sa ni sa la 'gyel ba'o //
translated: Earth is falling to the ground.

original: yang na sems te de cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: yang na sems te de cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: Or it is the mind. How is it superior?

original: de skad ces pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dbyer med pa khu ba dang bde ba'i rang bzhin de'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dbyer med pa khu ba dang bde ba'i rang bzhin de'o //
translated: That is the nature of method and wisdom, inseparable, the nature of semen and bliss.

original: gang gi tshe thos nas ni 'dzag nas don rtogs tsam gyis gnyi ga yang thos par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyis 'di skad ba dag gis thos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe thos nas ni 'dzag nas don rtogs tsam gyis gnyi ga yang thos par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyis 'di skad ba dag gis thos pa yin no //
translated: When, having heard, it drips, then by the mere understanding of the meaning, both are heard by oneself, as it is said, “Thus have I heard.”

original: yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud las //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud las //
translated: In the Tantra of Correct Practice,

original: 'dzag pa ni thos pa yin pa'i don rtogs pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas so //
analyzed: 'dzag pa ni thos pa yin pa'i don rtogs pa yin par bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas so //
translated: it is said by the Bhagavān that dripping is hearing, and the understanding of the meaning.

original: lung yin pa'i phyir nges par bstan pas rtags kyi tshig la sogs pa thams cad nges pa med pa nyid do //🔽gang las 'dzag pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: lung yin pa'i phyir nges par bstan pas rtags kyi tshig la sogs pa thams cad nges pa med pa nyid do // gang las 'dzag pa de gsungs pa /
translated: Because it is scripture, all the words of the treatise, such as the words of the reason, are not definitive.

original: rdo rje snying po las te /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po las te /
translated: From where does it drip? It is said from the vajra essence.
